1, uncompressed ipv6 address like 'fe80:0:0:0:0:0:0:0/128'

commit_message:
Support uncompressed ipv6 address and abbreviated ipv4 address

Now neutron supports zero-compressed ipv6 address like
'2001:db8::10:10:10:0/120' and unabbreviated ipv4 address
like '10.0.0.0/24'.
This path will make neutron also support uncompressed ipv6
address and abbreviated ipv4 address. for example:
1, uncompressed ipv6 address like 'fe80:0:0:0:0:0:0:0/128'
2, ipv6 address with multiple consecutive zero like
   '2001:0db8:0:0:1::1/128' or '2001::0:1:0:0:1100/120'
3, abbreviated ipv4 address like '10/24'

Change-Id: I755e38ea11c139e15488ec60e7d5682a244ab114
Closes-Bug: #1240790

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-28 15:09:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'db tests: replace assertEquals with assertEqual

In Python 2.6, both assertEqual and assertEquals are
convenience aliases to failUnlessEqual.

In Python 3, failUnlessEqual is explicitly deprecated.

This is part of blueprint assertequal

Change-Id: If364d79ea3c88d52e39b0d50230e191923121501
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-11-02 17:35:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py'], 'message': 'db tests: replace assertEquals with assertEqual

assertEquals will be deprecated in Python 3.

This is part of blueprint assertequal

Change-Id: If364d79ea3c88d52e39b0d50230e191923121501
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
db tests: replace assertEquals with assertEqual

assertEquals will be deprecated in Python 3.

This is part of blueprint assertequal

Change-Id: If364d79ea3c88d52e39b0d50230e191923121501

commit_message:
Install Guide: Move database section to main neutron.conf

The [database] section has been moved from the plugin files
to the main neutron.conf file for Havana. Follow this change
in all examples.

Also, tag controller with <replaceable> in Neutron chapter.

commit_message:
Do not run apt-get update in offline mode

Whatever apt source lists are on the image will be sufficient and
will be more likely to hit local caches and thus not reach out to
the internet.

Change-Id: Ia21f9a6e3506c7caa71e6c3e3c55b8f4cd0a22e5

commit_message:
Set Nova Scheduler to Depend on python-cinderclient

Nova Scheduler depends on the cinderclient python library.
However, it's Puppet file doesn't make it depend on the
cinderclient library, so when it is installed by itself
(i.e. as the only service on that particular node), the
scheduler service fails to start due to the missing libary.
This has now been corrected.

Fixes: bug #1246103
Change-Id: I23e7e429d663fc501c1c3e397f82b0496cf646e6

relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt. This
API call locates a suitable host within the same

instance's location to the new host (similar to a rebuild). This
call is only available to users with the Admin role.

Rebuild instances uses the task based workflow.
Compute api calls the conductor task api. Conductor used scheduler
to select destination if required. Else compute on the destination

commit_message:
Evacuate instance to a scheduled host

In the event of a unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt. This
API call locates a suitable host within the same
cell (using nova-scheduler), and performs an update of the
instance's location to the new host (similar to a rebuild). This
call is only available to users with the Admin role.

Rebuild instances uses the task based workflow.
Compute api calls the conductor task api. Conductor used scheduler
to select destination if required. Else compute on the destination
host gets called.

DocImpact

blueprint find-host-and-evacuate-instance

Change-Id: I45147bb6818e9590831ae331cb43c2367f9c1c6f

commit_message:
VMware: Change cluster_name from MultiStr to ListOpt

Currently, the vmware driver uses MultiStrOpt for the cluster_name.
Hence, we need to repeat cluster_name property in the config file.
It is easier to specify them as list of comma seperated values.

DocImpact

Change-Id: If571877fbffb79d90128e27c446447fb105e87c4

The patch addresses three issues affecting the code coverage of

1. File permissions on some test files are incorrectly set to 744.

commit_message:
Fix issues affecting vmware driver code coverage

The patch addresses two issues affecting the code coverage of
the vmware driver.

1. Redundant use of events in a polling function affects coverage
tool to overlook code that is actually executed.
2. Unused private methods, other methods in vmops file have been
removed.

Closes-Bug #1231848
Change-Id: Ief45cefa929ef0386f9062afb567426d336153da

commit_message:
Moves system tests so they can be run by testr

System tests (tests depending on a live database, server, etc.)
are being consolidated into a new location.  They are also being
excluded by default when using testr.

Change-Id: Ib36b199c869ca402b82f20c5267681b2e3b08c47
Fixes-Bug: #1243392

commit_message:
Replaces assertEqual with assertTrue and assertFalse

In order to improve coding practices and be aligned to a standard,
self.assertEqual(...,True) statements where replaced with
self.assertTrue and self.assertFalse.

Change-Id: Ide0bcef3f552810a5a3946b3fd04376a54733fcb
Closes-Bug: #1230127

subject: Adds Support for Havana Configuration File Format
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-31 18:36:45.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/agents/ovs.pp', 'spec/classes/neutron_agents_ovs_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/neutron_quota_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/quota.pp', 'spec/classes/neutron_plugins_linuxbridge_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ovs_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/neutron_agents_linuxbridge_spec.rb', 'manifests/agents/linuxbridge.pp', 'manifests/plugins/linuxbridge.pp', 'manifests/plugins/ovs.pp'], 'message': 'Adds Support for Havana Configuration File Format

Previously, all sections of configuraiton files used capital
letters, i.e. [VLANS].  In Havana, only the [DEFAULT] section is
in captial letters.  Without this patch, configurtion files contain
duplicate sections, one in lower case and the other in upper case.
This causes confusion with users and leads to misconfiguration.

Change-Id: I9de057f8f845417a74d48946f38e0601727959b1
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adds Support for Havana Configuration File Format

Previously, all sections of configuraiton files used capital
letters, i.e. [VLANS].  In Havana, only the [DEFAULT] section is
in captial letters.  Without this patch, configurtion files contain
duplicate sections, one in lower case and the other in upper case.
This causes confusion with users and leads to misconfiguration.

Change-Id: I9de057f8f845417a74d48946f38e0601727959b1

commit_message:
avoid changing the rule's own action

fixes Bug #1240812

When iterating through the rule list, we should not change the rule itself.
So that we can use the rule data for the second router.

Change-Id: I613438507949007bec41416e7f8530693e4d5129
(cherry picked from commit c8b07d52936c9cfea5784e0efca3bc86e4aba7cc)

commit_message:
html_body

Adds simple HTML rendering for keystone
This makes sense when viewing Keystone from a web browser.
Merges all of the content type processing into a single middleware component
with logical ordering of procesing for the types.

blueprint render-html

Change-Id: I09d5b782cba45c8ac51f21a68c1176a0df05bc41

subject: Cleanup for Per-Domain-Identity
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-09 09:41:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cleanup for Per-Domain-Identity

Perform a chunk of the cleanup needed for per-domain-identity
backends.  This includes ensureing that domain_scope is passed in
the relevant @domains_configured methods on the Identity Manager,
adding in a mechanism to extract the domain_id from the context
during the @protected decorator execution, among other bits of
refactoring.

If possible, domain_id was extracted from project/tenant that
was passed into methods that required it.

The assignment_api also saw some basic cleanup (continuation)
on doing lookups for users or groups against the identity_api.
This was to simplify the interactions for determining domain_scope
and were not-required as the controller already handled the
verification of the user/group against the identity_api.

This also handles cleaning up a couple domain related edge cases
that could trigger undesireable behavior. (e.g. delete_domain
not succeeding beyond deleting tokens/credentials for the
first user or group on a read-only LDAP backend).

This patchset is targeted to be the minimum required to get
the per-domain-identity-driver concept to an "expirimental"
stage (with some known issues).

Known issues (partial list):
* Many cross-domain scenarios do not work with multiple id
  backends. e.g. It is not possible to create a grant for a user
  in one domain (on a specific backend) for a project that is in
  a domain on a differing identity backend.

* There is no concept of a "cloud admin" or super-admin user with
  multiple identity backends.  A number of actions (e.g.
  delete_user) requires the "admin" user to be a member of the
  domain of the user that is to be deleted.

* All v2.0 Calls (intentionally) will only reference the
  configured default_domain.

* Authenticating by user_id only will not result in the correct
  domain to be used if the user is not in the default_domain's
  driver.  It is possible to pass in a domain element (similar
  to authenticating with user_name) that will be used to look
  up the correct identity backend.

partial-bug: 1218094
Change-Id: I73ac2d2db6e766efe6ebd41a4ad9a701b2fac7a3

commit_message:
Cleanup for Per-Domain-Identity

Perform a chunk of the cleanup needed for per-domain-identity
backends.  This includes ensureing that domain_scope is passed in
the relevant @domains_configured methods on the Identity Manager,
adding in a mechanism to extract the domain_id from the context
during the @protected decorator execution, among other bits of
refactoring.

If possible, domain_id was extracted from project/tenant that
was passed into methods that required it.

The assignment_api also saw some basic cleanup (continuation)
on doing lookups for users or groups against the identity_api.
This was to simplify the interactions for determining domain_scope
and were not-required as the controller already handled the
verification of the user/group against the identity_api.

This also handles cleaning up a couple domain related edge cases
that could trigger undesireable behavior. (e.g. delete_domain
not succeeding beyond deleting tokens/credentials for the
first user or group on a read-only LDAP backend).

This patchset is targeted to be the minimum required to get
the per-domain-identity-driver concept to an "expirimental"
stage (with some known issues).

Known issues (partial list):
* Many cross-domain scenarios do not work with multiple id
  backends. e.g. It is not possible to create a grant for a user
  in one domain (on a specific backend) for a project that is in
  a domain on a differing identity backend.

* All v2.0 Calls (intentionally) will only reference the
  configured default_domain.

* Authenticating by user_id only will not result in the correct
  domain to be used if the user is not in the default_domain's
  driver.  It is possible to pass in a domain element (similar
  to authenticating with user_name) that will be used to look
  up the correct identity backend.

partial-bug: 1218094
Change-Id: I73ac2d2db6e766efe6ebd41a4ad9a701b2fac7a3

commit_message:
Comply with new hacking requirements

With new hacking>=0.8.0,<0.9 requirements, some functions are
now deprecated.

assertEquals -> assertEqual
assertNotEquals -> assertNotEqual
assert_ -> assertTrue

commit_message:
Sync config file generator from oslo

This commit syncs in the sample config generator from Oslo-incubator.
This will enable the sample file to be auto generated instead of
managing it by hand which is prone to errors.

Partially Implements: blueprint config-cleanup

Change-Id: Ic2553da72de5978b5d721d2ddb4c68ec1bf5005d

subject: Added set_endpoints_by_interface recipe & attributes to support 'bind_interface'
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 21:52:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Added `endpoints` recipe and attributes to support `bind_interface`

Added endpoints recipe to enable iterating over the contents of the
node['openstack']['endpoints'] hash and finding any non-nil `bind_interface` to
set the IP address. For example

    node['openstack']['endpoints']['identity']['bind_interface'] = 'eth0'

would set

    node['openstack']['endpoints']['identity']['host']

to whatever IP address was on 'eth0' rather than hard-code the IP addresses in
an Environment.

commit_message:
Added set_endpoints_by_interface recipe & attributes to support 'bind_interface'

Added set_endpoints_by_interface recipe to enable iterating over the contents of
the node['openstack']['endpoints'] hash and finding any non-nil `bind_interface`
to set the IP address. For example

    node['openstack']['endpoints']['identity']['bind_interface'] = 'eth0'

would set

    node['openstack']['endpoints']['identity']['host']

to whatever IP address was on 'eth0' rather than hard-code the IP addresses in
an Environment.

Change-Id: Ic07626d4e3b3fb743191077f95c5bdd04a5504cd

commit_message:
Use the image-api endpoint within the image_image LWRP for non-localhost uploads

Also updated the CLI glance usage to non-deprecated parameters. Immediate
service restart on the glance-api.conf template to catch updates to the
configuration.

Change-Id: I1f05bc367ccd06d2116e45f046897d9dff689f37

* Do not role restrict super_admin_key in proxy config.  At one
point it was thought this may increase security by having the
super key only available on the management server, but this
is incompatible with some addon pipeline items like tempurl.
* Correct swauth_version attribute in proxy recipe which was
referenced incorrectly as swauth-version, leading to no swauth
installation action taking place

super key only available on the management server, but this
is incompatible with some addon pipeline items like tempurl.
* Correct swauth_version attribute in proxy recipe which was
referenced incorrectly as swauth-version, leading to no swauth
installation action taking place
* Treat platform_options["swauth_packages"] properly as a
list which is how it is defined in attributes
* Further discoveries of swauth-source vs swauth_soruce
discrepancies corrected

commit_message:
Super_admin_key role restriction and attrib fixes

* Do not role restrict super_admin_key in proxy config.  At one
point it was thought this may increase security by having the
super key only available on the management server, but this
is incompatible with some addon pipeline items like tempurl.
* Correct swauth_version attribute in proxy recipe which was
referenced incorrectly as swauth-version, leading to no swauth
installation action taking place
* Treat platform_options["swauth_packages"] properly as a
list which is how it is defined in attributes
* Further discoveries of swauth-source vs swauth_source
discrepancies corrected
* Cleanup guard check for swauth packages

Change-Id: Ia0579a4518f45f7a6d5602c22351361424134d85

commit_message:
Default region loading an old-style pickled ring

This is to support upgrades from swift < 1.8 using old-style pickled
rings to 1.10. Old-style pickled rings won't have region information.

Change-Id: I18b2acba3d346e41def9d25d3d4dbd12705e5375
Closes-Bug: #1248919

commit_message:
Add mask password impl from other projects

A couple of different projects have an implementation for 'masking'
passwords in logs and wsgi output.

This seems like something that should go into Oslo-incubator as a common
implementation. This implementation is based off the following two
implementations in Keystone and Nova:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26487/12
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/49664/

Partial-Bug: #1247217

Change-Id: I2b1bbb4d3ddaa163573b685b3e3a5e8a3977e390

commit_message:
Add TempHomeDir fixture which is already part of cookiecutter template

TempHomeDir fixture creates a temporary directory and sets it as $HOME in the
environment. Also tearDown will remove it and reverts back $HOME value to
the previous one.

1. In one of the review comments for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/55111,
   russellb suggested to add TempHomeDir fixture to test module.

2. Cookiecutter template for OpenStack based projects already has this.

Change-Id: I7bd86a9d1e1951e04a632cecb181fc1e2c30f392

commit_message:
early quorum responses

Allow the proxy to respond to many types of requests as soon as it has a
quorum.  This can help speed up responses (without changing the results),
especially when one node is acting up.

I had to fix a few unit tests that no longer match the backend http requests
made by our proxy.

Change-Id: Ieb070dc3019e217e717b96154a7a809409bf40a5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-28 18:11:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "SSync (RSync Alternative)

This is still a work-in-progress; but mostly I just have more tests
to write so I wanted to push this up for anyone who'd care to start
an early review. :)

I will add a more appropriate comment message, etc. before bumping
this out of WORKINPROGRESS.

Change-Id: If003dcc6f4109e2d2a42f4873a0779110fff16d6
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-28 18:42:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "SSync (RSync Alternative)

This is still a work-in-progress; but mostly I just have
more tests to write so I wanted to push this up for anyone
who'd care to start an early review. :)

SSync for this commit is just a direct replacement for how
we use RSync. Assuming we switch over to SSync completely
someday and drop RSync, we will then be able to improve the
algorithms even further (removing local objects as we
successfully transfer each one rather than waiting for whole
partitions, using an index.db with hash-trees, etc., etc.)

For easier review, this commit can be thought of in distinct
parts:

1)  New global_conf_callback functionality for allowing
    services to perform setup code before workers, etc. are
    launched. (This is then used by SSync in the object
    server to create a cross-worker semaphore to restrict
    concurrent incoming replication.)

2)  A bit of shifting of items up from object server and
    replicator to diskfile or DEFAULT conf sections for
    better sharing of the same settings. conn_timeout,
    node_timeout, client_timeout, network_chunk_size,
    disk_chunk_size.

3)  Modifications to the object server and replicator to use
    SSync in place of RSync. This is done in a generic
    enough way that switching to FutureSync should be easy
    someday.

4)  The biggest part, and (at least for now) completely
    optional part, are the new ssync_sender and
    ssync_receiver files. Nice and isolated for easier
    testing and visibility into test coverage, etc.

Change-Id: If003dcc6f4109e2d2a42f4873a0779110fff16d6
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-08-29 16:32:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "SSync (RSync Alternative)

Change-Id: If003dcc6f4109e2d2a42f4873a0779110fff16d6
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2013-09-19 16:23:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "SSync (RSync Alternative)

This is still a work-in-progress; but mostly I just have
more tests to write so I wanted to push this up for anyone
who'd care to start an early review. :)

SSync for this commit is just a direct replacement for how
we use RSync. Assuming we switch over to SSync completely
someday and drop RSync, we will then be able to improve the
algorithms even further (removing local objects as we
successfully transfer each one rather than waiting for whole
partitions, using an index.db with hash-trees, etc., etc.)

For easier review, this commit can be thought of in distinct
parts:

1)  New global_conf_callback functionality for allowing
    services to perform setup code before workers, etc. are
    launched. (This is then used by SSync in the object
    server to create a cross-worker semaphore to restrict
    concurrent incoming replication.)

2)  A bit of shifting of items up from object server and
    replicator to diskfile or DEFAULT conf sections for
    better sharing of the same settings. conn_timeout,
    node_timeout, client_timeout, network_chunk_size,
    disk_chunk_size.

3)  Modifications to the object server and replicator to use
    SSync in place of RSync. This is done in a generic
    enough way that switching to FutureSync should be easy
    someday.

4)  The biggest part, and (at least for now) completely
    optional part, are the new ssync_sender and
    ssync_receiver files. Nice and isolated for easier
    testing and visibility into test coverage, etc.

", 'number': 8}, {'created': '2013-10-13 18:04:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Object replication ssync (an rsync alternative)

For this commit, ssync is just a direct replacement for how
we use rsync. Assuming we switch over to ssync completely
someday and drop rsync, we will then be able to improve the
algorithms even further (removing local objects as we
successfully transfer each one rather than waiting for whole
partitions, using an index.db with hash-trees, etc., etc.)

For easier review, this commit can be thought of in distinct
parts:

1)  New global_conf_callback functionality for allowing
    services to perform setup code before workers, etc. are
    launched. (This is then used by ssync in the object
    server to create a cross-worker semaphore to restrict
    concurrent incoming replication.)

2)  A bit of shifting of items up from object server and
    replicator to diskfile or DEFAULT conf sections for
    better sharing of the same settings. conn_timeout,
    node_timeout, client_timeout, network_chunk_size,
    disk_chunk_size.

3)  Modifications to the object server and replicator to
    optionally use ssync in place of rsync. This is done in
    a generic enough way that switching to FutureSync should
    be easy someday.

4)  The biggest part, and (at least for now) completely
    optional part, are the new ssync_sender and
    ssync_receiver files. Nice and isolated for easier
    testing and visibility into test coverage, etc.

All the usual logging, statsd, recon, etc. instrumentation
is still there when using ssync, just as it is when using
rsync.

Beyond the essential error and exceptional condition
logging, I have not added any additional instrumentation at
this time. Unless there is something someone finds super
pressing to have added to the logging, I think such
additions would be better as separate change reviews.

FOR NOW, IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED TO USE SSYNC ON PRODUCTION
CLUSTERS. Some of us will be in a limited fashion to look
for any subtle issues, tuning, etc. but generally ssync is
an experimental feature. In its current implementation it is
probably going to be a bit slower than rsync, but if all
goes according to plan it will end up much faster.

There are no comparisions yet between ssync and rsync other
than some raw virtual machine testing I've done to show it
should compete well enough once we can put it in use in the
real world.

If you Tweet, Google+, or whatever, be sure to indicate it's
experimental. It'd be best to keep it out of deployment
guides, howtos, etc. until we all figure out if we like it,
find it to be stable, etc.

", 'number': 16}, {'created': '2013-11-06 22:17:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Object replication ssync (an rsync alternative)

For this commit, ssync is just a direct replacement for how
we use rsync. Assuming we switch over to ssync completely
someday and drop rsync, we will then be able to improve the
algorithms even further (removing local objects as we
successfully transfer each one rather than waiting for whole
partitions, using an index.db with hash-trees, etc., etc.)

For easier review, this commit can be thought of in distinct
parts:

1)  New global_conf_callback functionality for allowing
    services to perform setup code before workers, etc. are
    launched. (This is then used by ssync in the object
    server to create a cross-worker semaphore to restrict
    concurrent incoming replication.)

2)  A bit of shifting of items up from object server and
    replicator to diskfile or DEFAULT conf sections for
    better sharing of the same settings. conn_timeout,
    node_timeout, client_timeout, network_chunk_size,
    disk_chunk_size.

3)  Modifications to the object server and replicator to
    optionally use ssync in place of rsync. This is done in
    a generic enough way that switching to FutureSync should
    be easy someday.

4)  The biggest part, and (at least for now) completely
    optional part, are the new ssync_sender and
    ssync_receiver files. Nice and isolated for easier
    testing and visibility into test coverage, etc.

All the usual logging, statsd, recon, etc. instrumentation
is still there when using ssync, just as it is when using
rsync.

Beyond the essential error and exceptional condition
logging, I have not added any additional instrumentation at
this time. Unless there is something someone finds super
pressing to have added to the logging, I think such
additions would be better as separate change reviews.

FOR NOW, IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED TO USE SSYNC ON PRODUCTION
CLUSTERS. Some of us will be in a limited fashion to look
for any subtle issues, tuning, etc. but generally ssync is
an experimental feature. In its current implementation it is
probably going to be a bit slower than rsync, but if all
goes according to plan it will end up much faster.

There are no comparisions yet between ssync and rsync other
than some raw virtual machine testing I've done to show it
should compete well enough once we can put it in use in the
real world.

If you Tweet, Google+, or whatever, be sure to indicate it's
experimental. It'd be best to keep it out of deployment
guides, howtos, etc. until we all figure out if we like it,
find it to be stable, etc.

commit_message:
Object replication ssync (an rsync alternative)

For this commit, ssync is just a direct replacement for how
we use rsync. Assuming we switch over to ssync completely
someday and drop rsync, we will then be able to improve the
algorithms even further (removing local objects as we
successfully transfer each one rather than waiting for whole
partitions, using an index.db with hash-trees, etc., etc.)

For easier review, this commit can be thought of in distinct
parts:

1)  New global_conf_callback functionality for allowing
    services to perform setup code before workers, etc. are
    launched. (This is then used by ssync in the object
    server to create a cross-worker semaphore to restrict
    concurrent incoming replication.)

2)  A bit of shifting of items up from object server and
    replicator to diskfile or DEFAULT conf sections for
    better sharing of the same settings. conn_timeout,
    node_timeout, client_timeout, network_chunk_size,
    disk_chunk_size.

3)  Modifications to the object server and replicator to
    optionally use ssync in place of rsync. This is done in
    a generic enough way that switching to FutureSync should
    be easy someday.

4)  The biggest part, and (at least for now) completely
    optional part, are the new ssync_sender and
    ssync_receiver files. Nice and isolated for easier
    testing and visibility into test coverage, etc.

All the usual logging, statsd, recon, etc. instrumentation
is still there when using ssync, just as it is when using
rsync.

Beyond the essential error and exceptional condition
logging, I have not added any additional instrumentation at
this time. Unless there is something someone finds super
pressing to have added to the logging, I think such
additions would be better as separate change reviews.

FOR NOW, IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED TO USE SSYNC ON PRODUCTION
CLUSTERS. Some of us will be in a limited fashion to look
for any subtle issues, tuning, etc. but generally ssync is
an experimental feature. In its current implementation it is
probably going to be a bit slower than rsync, but if all
goes according to plan it will end up much faster.

There are no comparisions yet between ssync and rsync other
than some raw virtual machine testing I've done to show it
should compete well enough once we can put it in use in the
real world.

If you Tweet, Google+, or whatever, be sure to indicate it's
experimental. It'd be best to keep it out of deployment
guides, howtos, etc. until we all figure out if we like it,
find it to be stable, etc.

Change-Id: If003dcc6f4109e2d2a42f4873a0779110fff16d6

commit_message:
Update the keystone configuration script for Barbican per Johns Hopkins team.

The Johns Hopkins team has been working to integrate Barbican in to their
encryption key management work flows. Hadi A. Esiely Barrera provided modifications
that were needed to the Barbican Keystone configuration script to make it
function correctly. This change request also restores the barbican-all script
as teams such as Johns Hopkins are utilizing it.

Change-Id: I764bd1606a0f8124660651104eb0dd58e82b9f6f

commit_message:
Fix a typo in the name of logger method exception

LOG has no attribute Exception. Should be LOG.exception insetead
of LOG.Exception.

commit_message:
Install Guide: Move database section to main neutron.conf

The [database] section has been moved from the plugin files
to the main neutron.conf file for Havana. Follow this change
in all examples.

Also, tag controller with <replaceable> in Neutron chapter.

Change-Id: Ie231bca650e8aac929605238086c645443c5b4ba
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1247589

commit_message:
Updates WADL to include missing call GET /v2/images/{imageId}/members

Also made the API description more accurate since you can't actually
create images in Glance, only image records.

Change-Id: Iac2b41bbf62e869a2eee0ea265deb2e56314cde8
Closes-Bug: #1248395

commit_message:
Improve sample configs

1) Rename sample-task.json to sample-task-boot-and-delete.json to be more
   specific; also restructure it a bit to bring it into compliance with
   sample-task-soft-reboot.json;
2) Add sample-cloud-verification.json that shows how to use verification.

Blueprint rally-docs

Change-Id: I8fa4f92c74ec49d8637cba131c9cd309028dc73a

[{'created': '2013-10-31 23:16:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't label or format disks for Ceph OSDs

Along with the changes from this https://github.com/Mirantis/fuel/pull/773
we no longer need to label Ceph disks. This removes superflous mkfs calls during
post-intallation and works around issues in ceph-deploy and ceph-disk.

commit_message:
Don't label or format disks for Ceph OSDs

Along with the changes from this https://github.com/Mirantis/fuel/pull/773
we no longer need to label Ceph disks. This removes superflous mkfs calls during
post-intallation and works around issues in ceph-deploy and ceph-disk.
Closes-Bug: #1246513

Change-Id: I91e6c253c164936c8b12798520cbd45587a36036

commit_message:
Debian consitency and links

This patch reviews the "Answer to the debconf" things in
every service, so that they look the same.

It also adds links to the debconf chapter, so that users
can navigate more easily in the doc.

It also changes the titles of the debconf chapter so that
they match the text in each chapter.

It also documents the fact that python-argparse should be
installed manually on all Wheezy setups, which is an issue
that has been reported by some users, and which wasn't
documented.

The patch also extends the explanations about the
meta-packages.

This patch adds a lot of <informalfigure> tags that were
missing as well.

Finally, the patch also moves the explanation about remote
MySQL setup from the nova installation procedure to the
debconf-dbconfig-common section of the debconf chapter,
which is a much better fit.

This is my last clean-up work, I believe.

Change-Id: I5a85f39e49786ae90cc0afbf13b94baf486408f4
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit f174fc2caab209061069621bfe26fb3edb75d6c7)

commit_message:
Refactor task updating flow in case of error and success

* if orchestrator reported that deployment
  task is ready, then all nodes should be
  in ready status, even if orchestrator
  didn't send statuses for this nodes
* if provisioning task failed, all nodes
  in provisioning status should be marked as
  error with error_type provision
* if deployment task failed, all nodes in
  status deploying should me marked as error
  with error_type deploy

PRD-2512
PRD-2381
PRD-2126

Change-Id: I0ce745dc393fdeca51b7190778c3c2d1ffccd23f

commit_message:
Ensure that L3 managed port have status ACTIVE

Some plugins may set the port status as DOWN when it is created. This was not
updated when the port was actually up. This patch ensures that gateway and
router ports that are created will be set as ACTIVE when they are actually
up and running.

Ports that are attached to additional bridges in the OVS will only update the
port status as ACTIVE. There will be no tags set on the specific ports as this
will break the existing functionality.

Fixes bug 1192883

(cherry picked from commit d88ea97228ec8bb38f071c3969fdbb3abf6ab575)

Conflicts:

	quantum/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_quantum_agent.py
	quantum/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py
	quantum/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_quantum_agent.py
	quantum/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py

Change-Id: I9993f56963ac704f0f345102d2e8b2d99dd9ad9e

commit_message:
Change list_resource_types() to return resources and status

To implement bp filter-resources-by-support api
function which will return all available resources with
its support status is needed.

This patch changes list_resource_types() api function
to return a dictionary like {'resource_type': 'support_status'}
instead of returning a list of resource types.

Add changes to heat/tests/test_engine_service.py

Implements bp filter-resources-by-support

Change-Id: I0c4fe3416fa728e6415e0563c1ae99f5df25be0c

commit_message:
Fix issues on CentOS.

1. On CentOS django 1.4.9 is used, that breaks new-style urls (full
support in django 1.5).

2. Also we have different murano-repository config on Fuel
installation, that also caused a bug due to hardcode in
murano-dashboard.

Change-Id: Ice4324c258330e790a51954c4ade58ba3fd7c6bc

subject: nova security-group-* should support uuid as input
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-04 06:40:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'nova security-group-* should support uuid as input

If we installed neutron, the security-group request will be handled
by neutron, however neutron is using uuid as key for security-group,
nova uses an int value as key, for current novaclient, it only
support the security-group which key is int, so will raise exception
for uuid input.

Change-Id: I8dedd58266c1182991b6ca24fefc0f220f8815d6
Fixes-Bug: #1247728
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-11-05 02:00:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'nova security-group-* should support uuid as input

commit_message:
nova security-group-* should support uuid as input

If we installed neutron, the security-group request will be handled
by neutron, however neutron is using uuid as key for security-group,
nova uses an int value as key, for current novaclient, it only
support the security-group which key is int, so will raise exception
for uuid input.

Change-Id: I8dedd58266c1182991b6ca24fefc0f220f8815d6
Fixes-Bug: #1247728

commit_message:
[PRD-2083] Run full check in verify_networks task

Now complete check_networks task will be executed within verify_networks task.
Only network configuration check was executed before that (w/o interfaces mapping check).

Closes-Bug: #1246297

commit_message:
Option for installing spice-html5 and novnc from packages

The novnc and spice-html5 is installed from git repository by default,
but not from an openstack* repository.

In order to add vnc/spice proxy related gating tests they should be installed
from packages.

New boolean variables added to control the installation source:
NOVNC_FROM_PACKAGE and SPICE_FROM_PACKAGE

Related changes:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/51790/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50822/

Change-Id: I1e55fd99edd30876924a13160afb74ff3e97c485

subject: Rename libvirt flags to more sane names
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-07 06:12:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/baremetal/volume_driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/blockinfo.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/tests/virt/baremetal/test_volume_driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/test_virt_drivers.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/firewall.py'], 'message': "Rename libvirt flags to more sane names

Now that the flags in nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py are in a libvirt
group, we can drop the libvirt_ from in front of many of the flag
names. I haven't done this where it would leave us with what I felt
was an overly generic flag name (for example libvirt.type), but
perhaps that's me being overly conservative.

Progresses blueprint libvirt-opts-group.

DocImpact: the following flags have had the libvirt_ dropped from
the start of their flag name now that they are in a flag group:
    libvirt_inject_password
    libvirt_inject_key
    libvirt_inject_partition
    libvirt_vif_driver
    libvirt_volume_drivers
    libvirt_disk_prefix
    libvirt_wait_soft_reboot_seconds
    libvirt_non_blocking
    libvirt_cpu_mode
    libvirt_cpu_model
    libvirt_snapshots_directory

Change-Id: Ia3875e48dd75c26d05332f8356368ae38f264e4e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename libvirt flags to more sane names

Now that the flags in nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py are in a libvirt
group, we can drop the libvirt_ from in front of many of the flag
names. I haven't done this where it would leave us with what I felt
was an overly generic flag name (for example libvirt.type), but
perhaps that's me being overly conservative.

Progresses blueprint libvirt-opts-group.

DocImpact: the following flags have had the libvirt_ dropped from
the start of their flag name now that they are in a flag group:
    libvirt_inject_password
    libvirt_inject_key
    libvirt_inject_partition
    libvirt_vif_driver
    libvirt_volume_drivers
    libvirt_disk_prefix
    libvirt_wait_soft_reboot_seconds
    libvirt_non_blocking
    libvirt_cpu_mode
    libvirt_cpu_model
    libvirt_snapshots_directory

Change-Id: Ia3875e48dd75c26d05332f8356368ae38f264e4e

commit_message:
Support security groups with XenAPI and OVS

iptables-restore and ip6tables-restore commands read their data from the
standard input. The neutron-rootwrap-xen-dom0 script and the netwrap
plugin have been modified to pass stdin from one to the other.
The netwrap plugin is also modified to allow iptables/ip6tables
commands.

Change-Id: I2b2d5589ffb14d11aef8f3d9c870fc5104433767
Closes-Bug: #1245809

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove native_pxe option.

This removes the Nova 'native_pxe' config option and just
sets dhcp_options_enabled=true by default in our nova.conf
config file. This will ensure Neutron native PXE is always
our default now and allow us to remove this option from
the heat templates as well.

Change-Id: I50da826666a30e65167f888dba7f48dbbf5f0b2a

subject: Preserve symlinks when writing output
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 16:42:54.000000000', 'files': ['os_apply_config/tests/test_apply_config.py', 'os_apply_config/apply_config.py'], 'message': 'Preserve symlinks when writing output

Sometimes a config file will have to exist as a readonly symlink on the
root filesystem pointing to a writable storage area. We need to be able
to write to that config file in this case.

Change-Id: I9af0f163c0a201222c0d09f7f2c5acc539088df6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Preserve symlinks when writing output

Sometimes a config file will have to exist as a readonly symlink on the
root filesystem pointing to a writable storage area. We need to be able
to write to that config file in this case.

Fixes bug #1245953

Change-Id: I9af0f163c0a201222c0d09f7f2c5acc539088df6

commit_message:
Change default database connection to using mongodb

Upstream uses MongoDB by default and, worse, SQL Alchemy (and
thereby MySQL) support is not fully functional yet.

Change-Id: I50c6efd0b632035038065ca9e1fa09f3a8d781fd

Previously, parser.Stack was exclusively using the tenant_id from
the request context.  However, when we load an existing stack, it makes
sense to use the existing tenant information from the stack in the

Change-Id: I0906cf067e7a3c3fb29a427b6fb7b49f2ee859a4
Closes-Bug: 1246123
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
parser.Stack accepts tenant_id as a param

Previously, parser.Stack was exclusively using the tenant_id from
the request context.  However, when we load an existing stack, it makes
sense to use the existing tenant information from the stack in the
db (the source of truth) rather than the tenant info from the request
context.

Change-Id: I0906cf067e7a3c3fb29a427b6fb7b49f2ee859a4
Closes-Bug: 1246123

commit_message:
Pluggable Extentions using multiple routes

Extentions can be organized in external directories
and linked to the trove code using configuration parameter
'api_extensions_dirlist', containing by default
'trove/extensions/routes' refering to default routes.

Change-Id: I321fa1c1afaa7d0ee3faf92e984520f887595f29
Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/extension-pluggable

commit_message:
feat(mongo): starts to use aggregation for stats

Aggregation pipeline might be slower than normal queries,
but in this approach we can combine two queries into one.

Change-Id: I2fad0834b7ee72970405ae745b152a87fcddf2c3
Closes-Bug: 1218789

commit_message:
No session_persistence information added

Added information to session_persistence attribute for VIP in main table.
Update: Fixed tag movement and moved session_persistence info to footnote as there didn't seem to be a way to break it in the table. Works better for me there anyway.

commit_message:
Raised an exception if no DHCP agent is active or alive

When a port is created, the plugin sends a RPC cast to the DHCP
agent(s) which assume this network in order to update their host file.
If the agent(s) aren't available (admin state down or not alive),
the patch delete the created port and raised an exception.

The patch modify DHCP notification. If the subnet has DHCP disable or if
a port doesn't have fixed IPs, no notifications or scheduling are set.

The patch adds a mock on method '_get_dhcp_agents' of the
'DhcpAgentNotifyAPI' class in the 'NeutronDbPluginV2TestCase' test
class in order to keep plugins run tests valid for plugins which
support 'dhcp_agent_scheduler' extension.

Link to bug #1185916

Change-Id: I0990c5a36dff6d716494a8bf479bf20d32bb6ec2

With this element we can reduce image size and build time by making

work. Many elements will need to be updated to use it, and we will

Change-Id: I8ee4708fb703ad12fcf9baa0aca76bcbbb760801
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add an install-packages element

With this element we can reduce image size and build time by making
package installation declarative and taking steps to reduce repeated
work. Many elements will need to be updated to use it, and we will
also need to add remove-packages scripts to the distro elements.

Change-Id: I8ee4708fb703ad12fcf9baa0aca76bcbbb760801

[{'created': '2013-10-21 23:48:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'blueprint cross-service-filter-scheduling

Relaxing policies to allow host retrieval for cross service scheduling

Change-Id: I3a755dfb9bae66183d11d81afe9b5d266c7a7d15
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-22 23:16:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Relax volume_host_attribute policies

The current policies for cinder allow only admin users to retrieve
the hostname where a volume is placed. In order to perform
cross-service scheduling we need this information to be available
for any user, as the is_admin flag of an elevated context is not
sent to cinder when using the REST api.

blueprint cross-service-filter-scheduling

Change-Id: I3a755dfb9bae66183d11d81afe9b5d266c7a7d15
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-28 21:15:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Relax volume_host_attribute policies

The current policies for cinder allow only admin users to retrieve
the hostname where a volume is placed. In order to perform
cross-service scheduling we need this information to be available
for any user, as the is_admin flag of an elevated context is not
sent to cinder when using the REST api.
Tests have also been modified to adapt to this new behavior.

blueprint cross-service-filter-scheduling

Change-Id: I3a755dfb9bae66183d11d81afe9b5d266c7a7d15

for any user, as the is_admin flag of an elevated context is not

Tests have also been modified to adapt to this new behavior.

Change-Id: I3a755dfb9bae66183d11d81afe9b5d266c7a7d15

commit_message:
Relax volume_host_attribute policies

The current policies for cinder allow only admin users to retrieve
the hostname where a volume is placed. In order to perform
cross-service scheduling we need this information to be available
for any user, as the is_admin flag of an elevated context is not
sent to cinder when using the REST api.
Tests have also been modified to adapt to this new behavior.

blueprint cross-service-filter-scheduling

Change-Id: I3a755dfb9bae66183d11d81afe9b5d266c7a7d15

subject: Fix the image name of a shelved server
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-30 15:09:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix the image name of a shelved server

The shelve feature powers a server off, and creates a snapshot of the
server. The snapshot image name is "instance-XXXXXXXXX-shelved" and it
doesn't contain a server name like the following:

  $ nova list
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  | ID | Name | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks         |
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  | .. | vm01 | ACTIVE | None       | Running     | private=10.0.0.5 |
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  $ nova shelve vm01
  $ nova image-list
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  | ID | Name                            | Status | Server |
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  | .. | instance-00000004-shelved       | ACTIVE | ..     |
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  $

"instance-XXXXXXXXX" is OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:instance_name, and a non-admin
cannot see it.

This patch changes the name to "<server name>-shelved", so that a non-
admin user can know the server name of a shelved image:

  $ nova image-list
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  | ID | Name               | Status | Server |
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  | .. | vm01-shelved       | ACTIVE | ..     |
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  $

Closes-Bug: 1232991

Change-Id: Idc73658e29cb77dfcc8b046535a36affc1831605
(cherry picked from commit abec25a7bafa4ca320ae222a34fc45ad3c1d27a8)
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix the image name of a shelved server

The shelve feature powers a server off, and creates a snapshot of the
server. The snapshot image name is "instance-XXXXXXXXX-shelved" and it
doesn't contain a server name like the following:

  $ nova list
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  | ID | Name | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks         |
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  | .. | vm01 | ACTIVE | None       | Running     | private=10.0.0.5 |
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  $ nova shelve vm01
  $ nova image-list
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  | ID | Name                            | Status | Server |
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  | .. | instance-00000004-shelved       | ACTIVE | ..     |
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  $

"instance-XXXXXXXXX" is OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:instance_name, and a non-admin
cannot see it.

This patch changes the name to "<server name>-shelved", so that a non-
admin user can know the server name of a shelved image:

  $ nova image-list
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  | ID | Name               | Status | Server |
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  | .. | vm01-shelved       | ACTIVE | ..     |
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  $

Closes-Bug: 1232991

Change-Id: Idc73658e29cb77dfcc8b046535a36affc1831605
(cherry picked from commit abec25a7bafa4ca320ae222a34fc45ad3c1d27a8)
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Sync units module from olso

There are lots of numeric expressions across some projects, such as
1024*1024 , 1024**3, 1000, 1000000 etc. This patch adds binary and
decimal unit constants. Replacing nummeric experssions with these
constants makes code more readable.

Change-Id: I45fb5a10009f22b1eedb07b3e52f1ce40403b068

commit_message:
Fix import log_handler error with publish_errors set

Sync from Olso.
Commit Id is Ibf28ba17f81b5ddeda653f6a3501ecac18ffcd42

This handler sends all error logs as rpc notifications.
Note: when using publish_errors you also need to set the
notification_driver option too.

Closes-bug: #1240349
Change-Id: I0d3ded8bdb5a26d67672d482979eea131e0ade3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-21 19:09:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Shelve/unshelve an instance

The basic idea is that an instance can be put into a shelved state which
snapshots it, unless volume backed, and powers it down.  A periodic task
on the compute nodes will clean up the instance after a configurable
period of time(default: 3 days).  This should allow for fast startup
times when an instance is shelved for a night or over a weekend, and
free up resources when left longer.

bp shelve-instance

Change-Id: I908474915c5325e120a64af9b9af13fcbce1f01c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-06-27 21:33:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Shelve/unshelve an instance

This adds the compute methods for shelving and unshelving.  Shelving
will power down the instance, and snapshot if not volume backed.
Unshelving will restore the instance, which may involve re-scheduling
and rebuilding it from a snapshot.

Part of bp shelve-instance

Change-Id: I908474915c5325e120a64af9b9af13fcbce1f01c

commit_message:
Shelve/unshelve an instance

This adds the compute methods for shelving and unshelving.  Shelving
will power down the instance, and snapshot if not volume backed.
Unshelving will restore the instance, which may involve re-scheduling
and rebuilding it from a snapshot.

Part of bp shelve-instance

Co-Author: Dan Smith <danms@us.ibm.com> (Instance objects)
Change-Id: I908474915c5325e120a64af9b9af13fcbce1f01c

subject: Modification for Ubuntu 13.10 and minor fixes in Neutron NEC plugin
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 06:47:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/nec', 'files/apts/trema', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/trema'], 'message': 'Modification for Ubuntu 13.10 and minor fixes in Neutron NEC plugin

Modifications for Ubuntu 13.10:
* Add .conf suffix to apache2 config files. In Ubuntu 13.10,
  files in sites-available should have ".conf" suffix.
  Otherwise it is not recognized by a2ensite.
* libglib2.0-dev is added to lib/files/apt/trema. Trema is
  an OpenFlow controler framework used by Neutron NEC plugin
  Ubuntu package dependency seems to be changed.

Minor cleanups are also done in OVS configuration:
* Set datapath_id before connecting to the OpenFlow controller
  to ensure datapath_id changes after connected.
  Previously datapath_id is changed after connecting to the controller.
* Drop "0x" prefix from datapath_id passed to OVS.
  OVS ignores datapath_id with 0x prefix.
* Fix a bug that SKIP_OVS_BRIDGE_SETUP skips all confiugration of
  the plugin agent. It should skip only OVS setup.

Change-Id: Ifac3def8decda577b5740c82fe8d24e8520c7777
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Modification for Ubuntu 13.10 and minor fixes in Neutron NEC plugin

Modifications for Ubuntu 13.10:
* Add .conf suffix to apache2 config files. In Ubuntu 13.10,
  files in sites-available should have ".conf" suffix.
  Otherwise it is not recognized by a2ensite.
* libglib2.0-dev is added to lib/files/apt/trema. Trema is
  an OpenFlow controler framework used by Neutron NEC plugin
  Ubuntu package dependency seems to be changed.

Minor cleanups are also done in OVS configuration:
* Set datapath_id before connecting to the OpenFlow controller
  to ensure datapath_id changes after connected.
  Previously datapath_id is changed after connecting to the controller.
* Drop "0x" prefix from datapath_id passed to OVS.
  OVS ignores datapath_id with 0x prefix.
* Fix a bug that SKIP_OVS_BRIDGE_SETUP skips all confiugration of
  the plugin agent. It should skip only OVS setup.

Change-Id: Ifac3def8decda577b5740c82fe8d24e8520c7777

subject: Clear correct device when deleting a ThinLVM snap
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1043, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 1215, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 4355, 'name': 'Avishay Traeger', 'email': 'avishay@stratoscale.com', 'username': 'avishay-il'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 8574, 'name': 'Qin Zhao', 'username': 'zhaoqin', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 21:41:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': "Clear correct device when deleting a ThinLVM snap

The LVM driver tries to wipe a device using dd when
a snapshot is deleted.  For ThinLVM, it is attempting
to wipe the /dev/mapper/cinder--volumes-<vol>-cow device,
which does not exist for ThinLVM.  This causes snapshot
deletion to fail for ThinLVM if volume clearing is on.

When using ThinLVM, only wipe the LV device rather than
attempting to wipe the -cow device.

This bug is only present in stable/grizzly (2013.1.4).
It does not exist in stable/havana or master due to these
changes:
f702fe7 Fix secure delete for thick LVM snapshots
de43923 Don't zero out thin provisioned LV's on delete

Closes-Bug: #1245529
Change-Id: I1d8dd618e51cc99b8947fbe0697a1c765c8251ba
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clear correct device when deleting a ThinLVM snap

The LVM driver tries to wipe a device using dd when
a snapshot is deleted.  For ThinLVM, it is attempting
to wipe the /dev/mapper/cinder--volumes-<vol>-cow device,
which does not exist for ThinLVM.  This causes snapshot
deletion to fail for ThinLVM if volume clearing is on.

When using ThinLVM, only wipe the LV device rather than
attempting to wipe the -cow device.

This bug is only present in stable/grizzly (2013.1.4).
It does not exist in stable/havana or master due to these
changes:
f702fe7 Fix secure delete for thick LVM snapshots
de43923 Don't zero out thin provisioned LV's on delete

Closes-Bug: #1245529
Change-Id: I1d8dd618e51cc99b8947fbe0697a1c765c8251ba

* Remove unused MIDONET specific settings from nova.conf

commit_message:
Refactors byte size extraction logic

The logic of _extract_bytes() in imageutils.QemuImgInfo
is not efficient. See
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41363/11/openstack/common/imageutils.py

This patch enhances the regex pattern to extract the byte size info
more efficiently.

Change-Id: I6efb3a6020179ac93c9d7848403c0fad0ebb1d1c

commit_message:
Fixed non-zero default policy index

Fixes integer conditional in the proxy container controller.
_backend_requests adds the policy header if the policy_index provided
evaluates to true. If policy with index 0 is not the default it can
never be set as it evalutes to false. Switched this statement to check
if policy_index is not None.

Closes-Bug: #1246107
Change-Id: I34a0551af1f07db76bb16844f6d11b515737a38f

subject: Check return code of command instead of checking stderr
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-06 20:30:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py'], 'message': 'Check return code of command instead of checking stderr

Command "ip link show" return a no 0 return code when passing
a no existing ip interface so we should use the return code
instead of checking stderr because stderr can contain messages
from the system even though the command succeeded.

Change-Id: Ic43e72dab3c5b6e266240b7ff7309ca3b44f8ed5
Closes-Bug: #1248699
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Check return code of command instead of checking stderr

Command "ip link show" return a no 0 return code when passing
a no existing ip interface so we should use the return code
instead of checking stderr because stderr can contain messages
from the system even though the command succeeded.

Change-Id: Ic43e72dab3c5b6e266240b7ff7309ca3b44f8ed5
Closes-Bug: #1248699

commit_message:
Fix the boto version comparison

Use versionutils to check the boto version in parsed form rather than
comparing text.

Fixes bug: 1239890

Change-Id: Iea421ab0d86ce29648a8b8f757456364ea21e956

subject: Alternate DiskFile constructor for efficient auditing.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 01:00:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Alternate DiskFile constructor for efficient auditing.

Before, to audit an object, the auditor:
 - calls listdir(object-hash-dir)
 - picks out the .data file from the listing
 - pulls out all N of its user.swift.metadata* xattrs
 - unpickles them
 - pulls out the value for 'name'
 - splits the name into a/c/o
 - then instantiates and opens a DiskFile(a, c, o),
which does the following
 - joins a/c/o back into a name
 - hashes the name
 - calls listdir(object-hash-dir) (AGAIN)
 - picks out the .data file (and maybe .meta) from the listing (AGAIN)
 - pulls out all N of its user.swift.metadata* xattrs (AGAIN)
 - unpickles them (AGAIN)
 - starts reading object's contents off disk

Now, the auditor simply locates the hash dir on the filesystem (saving
one listdir) and then hands it off to
DiskFileManager.get_diskfile_from_audit_location, which then
instantiates a DiskFile using the new .from_hash_dir() constructor,
which avoids the requirement to have a name (saving one xattr
reading).

As part of this, DiskFile.open() will now quarantine a hash
"directory" that's actually a file. Before, the audit location
generator would skip those, but now they make it clear into
DiskFile(). It's better to quarantine them anyway, as they're not
doing any good the way they are.

Also, removed the was_quarantined attribute on DiskFileReader. Now you
can pass in a quarantine_hook callable to DiskFile.reader() that gets
called if the file was quarantined. Default is to log quarantines, but
otherwise do nothing.

Change-Id: I04fc14569982a17fcc89e00832725ae71009335a

commit_message:
Alternate DiskFile constructor for efficient auditing.

Before, to audit an object, the auditor:
 - calls listdir(object-hash-dir)
 - picks out the .data file from the listing
 - pulls out all N of its user.swift.metadata* xattrs
 - unpickles them
 - pulls out the value for 'name'
 - splits the name into a/c/o
 - then instantiates and opens a DiskFile(a, c, o),
which does the following
 - joins a/c/o back into a name
 - hashes the name
 - calls listdir(object-hash-dir) (AGAIN)
 - picks out the .data file (and maybe .meta) from the listing (AGAIN)
 - pulls out all N of its user.swift.metadata* xattrs (AGAIN)
 - unpickles them (AGAIN)
 - starts reading object's contents off disk

Now, the auditor simply locates the hash dir on the filesystem (saving
one listdir) and then hands it off to
DiskFileManager.get_diskfile_from_audit_location, which then
instantiates a DiskFile in a way that lazy-loads the name later
(saving one xattr reading).

As part of this, DiskFile.open() will now quarantine a hash
"directory" that's actually a file. Before, the audit location
generator would skip those, but now they make it clear into
DiskFile(). It's better to quarantine them anyway, as they're not
doing any good the way they are.

Also, removed the was_quarantined attribute on DiskFileReader. Now you
can pass in a quarantine_hook callable to DiskFile.reader() that gets
called if the file was quarantined. Default is to log quarantines, but
otherwise do nothing.

Change-Id: I04fc14569982a17fcc89e00832725ae71009335a

commit_message:
Fix swauth package install

Forgot to iterate over the attribute so swauth wasn't being installed.

* Add back in forgotten .each to the end of platform_options
* Fix specs to take account of the above
* Bump metadata

Change-Id: I235a1337fc60bcfbd0aa2c4f047e5a184d217027

subject: Don't reset tasks to PENDING state while reverting
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-31 09:42:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't reset tasks to PENDING state while reverting

While flow is in REVERTING or REVERTED state, reverted tasks are now
left in REVERTED state. They are then reset to PENDING state when flow
is run again. With this change:

- when task is in REVERTED state, its result (if task were
  successfully executed before) is removed, but its failure (if its
  execution or reversion failed) is still available from storage;
- when flow is in REVERTED or FAILURE states, you can get all task
  failures from storage;
- if flow is in REVERTED or REVERTING state, but task is in PENDING
  state, it means this task was never executed;
- flow cannot transition from REVERTED to RUNNING state any more -- it
  should go through PENDING state; on REVERTED -> PENDING transition
  tasks of the flow are reset.

This ensures that failure is available until it becomes irrelevant.

Closes-bug: #1246612
Change-Id: I27c3891f5d412d6de6240638b5014afda94a58a4

commit_message:
Don't reset tasks to PENDING state while reverting

While flow is in REVERTING or REVERTED state, reverted tasks are now
left in REVERTED state. They are then reset to PENDING state when flow
is run again. With this change:

- when task is in REVERTED state, its result (if task were
  successfully executed before) is removed, but its failure (if its
  execution or reversion failed) is still available from storage;
- when flow is in REVERTED or FAILURE states, you can get all task
  failures from storage;
- if flow is in REVERTED or REVERTING state, but task is in PENDING
  state, it means this task was never executed;
- flow cannot transition from REVERTED to RUNNING state any more -- it
  should go through PENDING state; on REVERTED -> PENDING transition
  tasks of the flow are reset.

This ensures that failure information is available until it becomes
irrelevant.

Closes-bug: #1246612
Change-Id: I27c3891f5d412d6de6240638b5014afda94a58a4

commit_message:
Forced isolation for the nova quota test

Several test cases like quota related tests should not be done without
creating a new tenant in all cases.

This change enforces the isolated code path for the nova quota tests.
These tests requires admin rights anyway, so probably no one want to
try to run them without admin permissions.

Change-Id: Ib7550bc68f493ce9c6acbd57fc2d901e14ec2fef

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 16:55:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixes Hyper-V snapshot spawning issue

In Hyper-V, snapshoting an instance and then spawning a new
one using the resulted snapshot image with the same flavor,
will result an Hyper-V Exception.

Hyper-V will get the request to resize the base image to it's
actual size, leading to an error.

The reason is that the logic of the resize_vhd method has been
changed, as it is meant to resize images to the flavor size minus
the image metadata size, thus it's maximum internal size. For this
reason, the way to decide whether the root image should be resized
or not must also be changed.

So, instead of comparing the root image and base image sizes,
we should compare their maximum internal sizes.

Closes-Bug: #1234759

Change-Id: I83d2df76b726d705cedc52a8309a2be7037d6a79
(cherry picked from commit efdca8eeaffe6e63d57243147658f4691da3d89e)

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V snapshot spawning issue

In Hyper-V, snapshoting an instance and then spawning a new
one using the resulted snapshot image with the same flavor,
will result an Hyper-V Exception.

Hyper-V will get the request to resize the base image to it's
actual size, leading to an error.

The reason is that the logic of the resize_vhd method has been
changed, as it is meant to resize images to the flavor size minus
the image metadata size, thus it's maximum internal size. For this
reason, the way to decide whether the root image should be resized
or not must also be changed.

So, instead of comparing the root image and base image sizes,
we should compare their maximum internal sizes.

Closes-Bug: #1234759

Change-Id: I83d2df76b726d705cedc52a8309a2be7037d6a79
(cherry picked from commit efdca8eeaffe6e63d57243147658f4691da3d89e)

subject: Use auth_url as mgmt_url if not admin identity
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-06 11:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/test_http.py', 'keystoneclient/httpclient.py'], 'message': 'Use auth_url as mgmt_url if not admin identity

When admin identity endpoint is not found from the returned service catalog,
the given message error is ‚ÄúUnable to authorize user‚Äù by shell.py, therefore
this is a weak feedback to the real problem that is happening, given who
raised this error is httpclient.py (AuthorizationFailure Exception) with a
better message ‚ÄúCurrent authorization does not have a known management url‚Äù
but this one is suppressed by the message in shell.py, so to solve this bug
is possible to attempt to use the auth_url as management_url.

Change-Id: Icbdb0fda3fb7f6e9e1be95c7938b941af2bb2932
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use auth_url as mgmt_url if not admin identity

When admin identity endpoint is not found from the returned service catalog,
the given message error is ‚ÄúUnable to authorize user‚Äù by shell.py, therefore
this is a weak feedback to the real problem that is happening, given who
raised this error is httpclient.py (AuthorizationFailure Exception) with a
better message ‚ÄúCurrent authorization does not have a known management url‚Äù
but this one is suppressed by the message in shell.py, so to solve this bug
is possible to attempt to use the auth_url as management_url.

Change-Id: Icbdb0fda3fb7f6e9e1be95c7938b941af2bb2932

When admin identity endpoint is not found from the returned service catalog,
the given message error is ‚ÄúUnable to authorize user‚Äù by shell.py, therefore
this is a weak feedback to the real problem that is happening, given who
raised this error is httpclient.py (AuthorizationFailure Exception) with a
better message ‚ÄúCurrent authorization does not have a known management url‚Äù
but this one is suppressed by the message in shell.py, so to solve this bug

commit_message:
Flavor name should not contain only white spaces

Returns 400 Bad request instead of 200 Ok if flavor name
contains only whitespaces.
Flavor name containing any leading and trailing whitespaces will be
trimmed before validation and before saving it to the backend.

Added unit test cases for both v2 and v3 api's. For v3 api instead of
stubbing flavors 'create' method stubbed db's 'flavor_create' method.
Also removed redundant code of stubbing 'flavor_create' method.

For example
name = "  "              #not allowed
name = "extra large"     #allowed
name = " extra large "   #allowed, but leading and trailing whitespaces
                         #will be trimmed (same as instance name)

Closes-Bug: #1237611

Change-Id: Ie68be299030a878a752dbfdcdfe5094f8427598a

removal operation the change contains atomistic DB API method to
retrieve results of a task.

commit_message:
Integrate 'Metadata Objects' table into 'Compose Service' form.

All actions in this table are still to be implemented (currently there
are stubs there).

Also some mechanism of value extraction from table should be
implemented (to actually select new files for a given service, as well
as add some files to a Service that doesn't exist yet).

Change-Id: Ia49edf186c22bbf443b51e70fb8cbac72e710e2a

revisions:

Changes the neutron plugin and router to support ml2. The openvswitch
and linuxbridge will be depreciated going forward to Icehouse.

Change-Id: I4aff2f647c8e0b0ae4014467290482e9ca351386
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-11-05 23:02:26.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron/os-config-applier/etc/neutron/neutron.conf', 'elements/neutron-server/install.d/80-neutron-server', 'elements/neutron/os-config-applier/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini'], 'message': 'Adding ml2 support to baremetal.

Changes the neutron plugin and router to neutron ml2. The Modular
Layer 2 (ml2) plugin is a framework allowing OpenStack Networking
to simultaneously utilize the variety of layer 2 networking
technologies. It currently works with the existing openvswitch,
linuxbridge, and hyperv L2 agents, and is intended to replace
and deprecate the monolithic plugins associated with those L2
agents.

Change-Id: I4aff2f647c8e0b0ae4014467290482e9ca351386
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Adding ml2 support to baremetal.

Changes the neutron plugin and router to neutron ml2. The Modular
Layer 2 (ml2) plugin is a framework allowing OpenStack Networking
to simultaneously utilize the variety of layer 2 networking
technologies. It currently works with the existing openvswitch,
linuxbridge, and hyperv L2 agents, and is intended to replace
and deprecate the monolithic plugins associated with those L2
agents.

Change-Id: I4aff2f647c8e0b0ae4014467290482e9ca351386

commit_message:
Replace assertEquals with assertEqual - tests/scheduler

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals
therefore we should use assertEqual instead.

This is part of blueprint assertequal

Change-Id: I5a6c6ac5d248ea1666f93196d21eb23e793b36d1

subject: xenapi: check for IP address in live migration pre check
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 13:17:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'xenapi: check for IP address in live migration pre check

A requirement for live migration is that the destination
host contains a management PIF with an IP address assigned.
If a host is broken (no IP), the compute log simply shows a generic
exception on the xenapi call host.migrate_receive.  We can
provide better information that the IP address is missing
by checking this prior to the call.

The unit test test_check_can_live_migrate_destination_with_block_migration
verifies this check.  The unit test
test_check_can_live_migrate_destination_block_migration_fails verifies an
exception can be raised from the call.

Fixes bug 1245592

Change-Id: Iaa6345f4bddf2f98efb4a5c9743da16ba8ae7b56
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-29 17:42:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/fake.py'], 'message': 'xenapi: check for IP address in live migration pre check

A requirement for live migration is that the destination
host contains a management PIF with an IP address assigned.
If a host is broken (no IP), the compute log simply shows a generic

by checking this prior to the call.

Closes-Bug: 1245592

Change-Id: Iaa6345f4bddf2f98efb4a5c9743da16ba8ae7b56
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-10-29 17:42:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'xenapi: check for IP address in live migration pre check

host contains a management PIF with an IP address assigned.

Change-Id: Iaa6345f4bddf2f98efb4a5c9743da16ba8ae7b56
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
xenapi: check for IP address in live migration pre check

A requirement for live migration is that the destination
host contains a management PIF with an IP address assigned.
If a host is broken (no IP), the compute log simply shows a generic
exception on the xenapi call host.migrate_receive.  We can
provide better information that the IP address is missing
by checking this prior to the call.

Closes-Bug: 1245592

Change-Id: Iaa6345f4bddf2f98efb4a5c9743da16ba8ae7b56

subject: Specifics for Debian install of Cinder
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-04 19:09:46.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_cinder-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_cinder-controller.xml'], 'message': "Specifics for Debian install of Cinder

This patch reviews the installation procedure for Cinder
in the Debian install-guide. It also moves the part which
explains how to setup the volume group on top of the
procedure, since that's ok for all operating systems, and
that's needed for Debian (a volume group must be present
before installing cinder-volume, otherwise it will not
be detected automatically, which adds more manual work).

Change-Id: I84914a3447664f70e0c5678f0445b9385ae3b8c8
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 0d7f0a6422b3a0e518b0d061f40bead9f1ad5d45)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Specifics for Debian install of Cinder

This patch reviews the installation procedure for Cinder
in the Debian install-guide. It also moves the part which
explains how to setup the volume group on top of the
procedure, since that's ok for all operating systems, and
that's needed for Debian (a volume group must be present
before installing cinder-volume, otherwise it will not
be detected automatically, which adds more manual work).

Change-Id: I84914a3447664f70e0c5678f0445b9385ae3b8c8
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 0d7f0a6422b3a0e518b0d061f40bead9f1ad5d45)

This was never actually used.  We discussed the feature this was for on

commit_message:
Remove live_snapshot plumbing

This was never actually used.  We discussed the feature this was for on
the mailing list extensively, and then again at the design summit.
Consensus is that this is not something we want to support.

Change-Id: I1dc0a1daa0667b3541f9e397abb2c9b1ea85f55e

commit_message:
Adds Database Configuration Support for Havana

Previously, database configuration information was stored in the
plugin .ini file.  As of Havana, a [database] section has been
created in neutron.conf to manage the database configuation for
all Neutron plugins:

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/stable/havana/etc/neutron.conf#L315

Additionaly, several database flags have changed from Grizzly to
Havana.  For backwards compatibility, the previously supported
database flags are contained in neutron::server with a default
of false.

Change-Id: I300fc12092bca1abdd105e0c0c272f7fd49258ac

commit_message:
Ensure keystone endpoint set before service starts

This patch ensures that in the case where keystone and
nova-api are on the same node, nova-api is not started
until the keystone catalog contains the compute service
and endpoint required to use nova.

commit_message:
Ensure keystone endpoint set before service starts

This patch ensures that in the case where keystone and
glance-api are on the same node, nova-api is not started
until the keystone catalog contains the image service
and endpoint required to use glance.

Change-Id: I48ae07b2d7789d549a4412a21e842a1222a48caa

commit_message:
Rename CHANGELOG to NEWS and package ChangeLog

As part of pbr's sdist, a git-commit ChangeLog is being generated,
that is useful for packagers that consume the git tarballs. Rename
the manually maintained CHANGELOG to NEWS to avoid naming issues
on case insensitive filesystems.

Change-Id: I1930213a8ad6f5f64f0721f8d9dad3f090ee3390
Fixes-Bug: 1186518

[{'created': '2013-10-18 23:55:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Avoid encode errors on invalid user create calls.

If the user create call features an invalid password it is normally
surfaced as a BadRequest exception. However, str() was used on the
original exception. That's bad, as if unicode is present the str() call
will raise, resulting in a 500 status code instead of a 400.

Fixes bug 1241877

Change-Id: Iaa59d9cb65af0932ae1e2fc6a9e4cbf88cc520ba
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-19 14:40:01.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/api/users.py', 'trove/extensions/mysql/service.py', 'trove/tests/literals.py'], 'message': "Avoid encode errors on invalid user create calls.

If the user create call features an invalid password it is normally
surfaced as a BadRequest exception. However, str() was used on the
original exception. That's bad, as if unicode is present the str() call
will raise, resulting in a 500 status code instead of a 400.

Fixes bug 1241877

Change-Id: Iaa59d9cb65af0932ae1e2fc6a9e4cbf88cc520ba
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Avoid encode errors on invalid user create calls.

If the user create call features an invalid password it is normally
surfaced as a BadRequest exception. However, str() was used on the
original exception. That's bad, as if unicode is present the str() call
will raise, resulting in a 500 status code instead of a 400.

Fixes bug 1241877

Change-Id: Iaa59d9cb65af0932ae1e2fc6a9e4cbf88cc520ba

commit_message:
(WIP) async import use case

This is a patch containing all the code necessary to do an import of
an image. Not intended to go in as it is and would be split into
multiple patches shortly after FF ends and ported on top of master.
It is also helping to maintain the code without breaking the depending
patches when a change to later one is proposed.

wip for bp async-glance-workers

Change-Id: I879eebcb8d3e0c85db02463b0e6c28d43a90c666

commit_message:
OpenStack Python API Guide

Introduces a new guide that documents how to use the Python APIs.

Currently in AsciiDoc format. Includes a makefile which converts
to DocBook.

Change-Id: I0a0a45fe3b93c09525961bc11f94d7e7731d47f2

commit_message:
change assert_ to assertTrue

According to http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html
assert_ is a deprecated alias of assertTrue.

Change-Id: I8cea77e8b8016be1dc629ed8f4c06fdc607d9842

commit_message:
Remove vim header from from nova/tests

This can just be set in your vimrc file. Also if set incorrectly gate
will catch this.

Change-Id: Ic5c9c75c90f2538aafb0eb1692f3ecda4e36fc5d

commit_message:
Change sqlalchemy default pool settings

Change the default value for sqlalchemy pool:
* max_pool_size=10
* max_overflow=20

The previous defaults was 5/10 that is not enought to record samples
produced during a full tempest tests.

Fixes bug #1243251

Change-Id: Ib9060b9da66c8dccb66a8db4994236b7da201ea2
