commit_message:
Remove vim header from from nova/virt

This can just be set in your vimrc file.
Just add the following to your vimrc:

au BufRead,BufNewFile *.py,*.pyw set sw=4 ts=4 expandtab textwidth=79
au BufNewFile *.py,*.pyw set fileformat=unix

Change-Id: I6a9842a48b4ebfc0e6a54ae569b37f9740e783ff

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-06 03:31:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "UDP memcache client

New cache middleware that uses UDP to talk to memcached.

This will hopefully help with situations where memcache is overwhelemed by TCP
connections before running out of other resources.  Testing will have to occur
to see how this pans out.

It acts as a mostly drop-in replacement for the current memcache client - just
change the cache filter in your proxy config from `memcache` to `udpmemcache`.

It implements the same hashing scheme, so switching won't cause a cache flush,
and they can happily co-exist in a cluster for testing purposes.

Change-Id: If7bf39309e923d6ec93c9ad99e29775c1dc85e2b

commit_message:
UDP memcache client

New cache middleware that uses UDP to talk to memcached.

This will hopefully help with situations where memcache is overwhelemed by TCP
connections before running out of other resources.  Testing will have to occur
to see how this pans out.

It acts as a mostly drop-in replacement for the current memcache client - just
change the cache filter in your proxy config from `memcache` to `udpmemcache`.

It implements the same hashing scheme, so switching won't cause a cache flush,
and they can happily co-exist in a cluster for testing purposes.

Change-Id: If7bf39309e923d6ec93c9ad99e29775c1dc85e2b

commit_message:
Docker: driver cannot destroy instance because context variable is
missing.

In some case is openstack not able to destroy/remove a instance
completely. The reason for that is that the destroy method in the docker
driver doesn't provide the optional "context" parameter.

Closes-bug: #1245466

Change-Id: I6e4bc2058d1c0f0e16c059e8433a1e74db99fd4d

commit_message:
migration is not working

if vnc_server_listen is bound to specific IP instead of 0.0.0.0,
libvirt cannot start the migrated VM from destination server.
It's because when libvirt migrate vm to other node it doesn't change
the vnc_server_listen port.

the 'force_config_drive' setting issue has also issue.
this option will be turned on though you set this as false.
(It's because of openstack nova's error)
and it's blocking migration from working because libvirt
also doesn't send the config_disk to the destination node
with having information in libvirt's XML data.

So, these two configs is making the live migration feature failed.

Closes-Bug: #1240759

Change-Id: Ic405cff751ddea56b0eaaf67f296e68845665fcc

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-27 19:09:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "remove pbr requirement

This makes swiftclient packaging work like every other python package in the
world.

I don't understand what pbr brings to the party, and on some operating systems
with older versiosn of pip, it prevents installation of swiftclient.

For a public client library, I think portability and simplicity of install
should trump whatever tertiary goals this is chasing.

Change-Id: I352acc5915c250145741ce7d2ba07a7327adf751

commit_message:
remove pbr requirement

On some operating systems with older versions of pip, pbr prevents installation
of swiftclient.  Or at least installing it isn't as straightforward as
"pip install python-swiftclient".

For a public client library, I think portability and simplicity of install
should trump whatever ci goals pbr is chasing.

I understand we'll lose tag-based versioning.  I personally don't think it's
worth the headache.

Closes-Bug: #1236947
Change-Id: I352acc5915c250145741ce7d2ba07a7327adf751

commit_message:

it doesn't overlap with a segment range in another
test that may be executed simultaneously.

subject: Fail quickly if file injection for boot volume
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-30 03:54:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/test_virt_disk.py', 'nova/virt/disk/api.py'], 'message': 'Fail quickly if file injection for boot volume

Previously if the user attempted file injection on a booted volume it
would fail and retry several times, which slowed down the instance
spawning.  Instead of attempting file injection, fail quickly, and
log a warning

Fix bug 1188543

Change-Id: I264540de736c2bcb92567826fe5ba672e1244ba2
(cherry picked from commit f59c2d64ac8f0523c587e23b2d1c59fdfe7ea131)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fail quickly if file injection for boot volume

Previously if the user attempted file injection on a booted volume it
would fail and retry several times, which slowed down the instance
spawning.  Instead of attempting file injection, fail quickly, and
log a warning

Fix bug 1188543

Change-Id: I264540de736c2bcb92567826fe5ba672e1244ba2
(cherry picked from commit f59c2d64ac8f0523c587e23b2d1c59fdfe7ea131)

commit_message:
Start using PyFlakes and Hacking

Instead of globally ignoring Pyflakes and Hacking
warnings, blacklist explitly only those that trigger
numerously. Fix the rest alongway and start to gate
on those that are now passing.

Change-Id: Ia19dc708cf0ccab2da5b46d1652f16e901499c24

subject: Clean up use of global conf vars in start_nova
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 16:26:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Clean up use of global conf vars in start_nova

Make it clear which services run in the API cell and compute (child)
cells by using appropriately named local variables for the conf files.
This should help save from future bugs.

Also: When cells is enabled, there's no need to run nova-conductor in
the API cell right now.  Cells bypasses any use of conductor in the API
cell.

Change-Id: I3af17d3db028f5df36814cb83c7db4de8f141f84
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-11-04 18:11:59.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': "Clean up use of global conf vars in start_nova

Make it clear which services run in the API cell and compute (child)
cells by using appropriately named local variables for the conf files.
This should help save from future bugs.

Also: When cells is enabled, there's no need to run nova-conductor in
the API cell right now.  Cells bypasses any use of conductor in the API
cell.

Change-Id: I3af17d3db028f5df36814cb83c7db4de8f141f84
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Clean up use of global conf vars in start_nova

Make it clear which services run in the API cell and compute (child)
cells by using appropriately named local variables for the conf files.
This should help save from future bugs.

Also: When cells is enabled, there's no need to run nova-conductor in
the API cell right now.  Cells bypasses any use of conductor in the API
cell.

Change-Id: I3af17d3db028f5df36814cb83c7db4de8f141f84

subject: Bugfix tempurl role restriction
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-05 05:12:31.000000000', 'files': ['templates/default/proxy-server.conf.erb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'metadata.rb'], 'message': 'Bugfix tempurl role restriction

The tempurl can be and should be enabled on all proxy servers.  When
restricted to just the management server, and requests are loadbalanced
among all proxy servers, the majority of tempurl requests will fail as
they will reach non-management servers.

Change-Id: Icae42a3c44c17251c3cebff3a9c4e05dc36990f7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Bugfix tempurl role restriction

The tempurl can be and should be enabled on all proxy servers.  When
restricted to just the management server, and requests are loadbalanced
among all proxy servers, the majority of tempurl requests will fail as
they will reach non-management servers.

Change-Id: Icae42a3c44c17251c3cebff3a9c4e05dc36990f7

subject: Bugfix allow_override spacing in proxy template
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-04 19:39:20.000000000', 'files': ['templates/default/proxy-server.conf.erb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'metadata.rb'], 'message': 'Bugfix allow_override spacing in proxy template

The white space at the beginning of the line in the allow_override
setting can end up being associated with the swauth url on the
preceeding line.  Removing the extra and unnecesary white space
resolves the issue.

Change-Id: I1ccb731cfb7a7a39b7b5026be345a6d50202930c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Bugfix allow_override spacing in proxy template

The white space at the beginning of the line in the allow_override
setting can end up being associated with the swauth url on the
preceeding line.  Removing the extra and unnecesary white space
resolves the issue.

Change-Id: I1ccb731cfb7a7a39b7b5026be345a6d50202930c

commit_message:
Fedora/CentOS specific fixes in devstack engine

Got following issues with Fedora and CentOS:

 * only tcp port 22 is open by default
 * requiretty is true in sudoers
 * no /sbin in $PATH

commit_message:
Add sleep_between() method to benchmark scenarios

This patch adds a helper sleep_between() method to the base.Scenario class
thus enabling the subscenarios to use it. The method performs a time.sleep()
call for a random amount of seconds from the given range and also counts the
amount of seconds slept to take them to account while calculating the running
time of a scenario.

Here also the NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server gets changed using the new
sleep_between method(): it can now (optionally) perform a sleep between
booting and deleting a server.

Blueprint benchmark-scenarios

Change-Id: I2a76dadbd8413cef0650c2af7cf5125188cb35ba

subject: Fix swift_test_client duplicating request params
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-05 12:29:59.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/swift_test_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix swift_test_client duplicating request params

Remove extra lines of code that result in
swift_test_client adding params twice to
PUT request urls.

Bug was revealed while developing functional
tests for SLO - SLO manifest PUTs behave incorrectly
because the url constructed by swift_test_client ends
with ?multipart-manifest=put?multipart-manifest=put

Fixes bug 1248121

Change-Id: Ie5a8651a55049bb52ef641edfd6eb29b0ff3c245
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix swift_test_client duplicating request params

Remove extra lines of code that result in
swift_test_client adding params twice to
PUT request urls.

Bug was revealed while developing functional
tests for SLO - SLO manifest PUTs behave incorrectly
because the url constructed by swift_test_client ends
with ?multipart-manifest=put?multipart-manifest=put

Fixes bug 1248121

Change-Id: Ie5a8651a55049bb52ef641edfd6eb29b0ff3c245

subject: Stop ignoring jenkins -1 votes
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-05 22:24:09.000000000', 'files': ['openreviews.py'], 'message': "Stop ignoring jenkins -1 votes

One of the age calculations is the time patches have been up without any
-1 or -2 votes.  This calculation basically just doesn't reset the timer
if a reviewer rebases their change, or fixes some things before anyone
points it out.

Originally I ignored jenkins here.  It really wasn't a good idea.  If
jenkins gives a -1 vote, people are not likely to go review it, so those
votes should be included here.

Change-Id: Iec8deac21a2cfc07bf23e0d0d75e8ea0a27646af
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop ignoring jenkins -1 votes

One of the age calculations is the time patches have been up without any
-1 or -2 votes.  This calculation basically just doesn't reset the timer
if a reviewer rebases their change, or fixes some things before anyone
points it out.

Originally I ignored jenkins here.  It really wasn't a good idea.  If
jenkins gives a -1 vote, people are not likely to go review it, so those
votes should be included here.

Change-Id: Iec8deac21a2cfc07bf23e0d0d75e8ea0a27646af

commit_message:
Added options to control sqlalchemy's DB pools.

Sites under heavier load may want to modify the default DB
pool settings. These are stored in the individual plugin inis,
so that is where they have been added.

Change-Id: I99c151ad0de85997bee78227825a53312127fefa

commit_message:
Filter valid networks to appear in create instance modal dialog

We cannot create a instance without assigning it a valid network
subnet. Therefore we present in the dialog the networks that
have a valid subnet.

Change-Id: I35e781041e8957d52b9ec974ac5507e593a793f5
Fixes Bug #1237711

Clean up the code by removing a variable that was used once.

Change-Id: I4c817702e39156619b8d6e17fd1ec022fde034e3

subject: Discovering refactoring
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-04 16:31:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Discovering refactoring

Discovering logic has been changed in order to perform some
optimisation. Now discovering process takes place at the time of
ostf-server startup and it loads to db all existing tests.
Also some data from db (test set and corresponding
to them tests data) is cached to provide fast access to this test
repository in future. Further discovering for particualar cluster is
done by adding to database some information that links needed test sets
and tests with cluster. Linking process uses data from cache so
discovering takes less time to be performed.

Change-Id: Ib8ce2c109a216e1e704d2050baaca71f3ad367ad

Discovering refactoring / non major fixes and tests refactoring

For TestRun class from models relationship for test sets via
association_proxy() function was established. It is need because of some
cleaning actions that are performed in standalone TestRun methods by
nose plugin which consume data that is stored in test sets objects.
Unit tests (except those for REST controllers) were updated.
Some additional non-major refactoring was performed.

Change-Id: I94ef205ee6d90426929746573c836f4de7cc7b24

commit_message:
Discovering refactoring

Discovering logic has been changed in order to perform some
optimisation. Now discovering process takes place at the time of
ostf-server startup and it loads to db all existing tests.
Also some data from db (test set and corresponding
to them tests data) is cached to provide fast access to this test
repository in future. Further discovering for particualar cluster is
done by adding to database some information that links needed test sets
and tests with cluster. Linking process uses data from cache so
discovering takes less time to be performed.

Change-Id: Ib8ce2c109a216e1e704d2050baaca71f3ad367ad

Discovering refactoring / non major fixes and tests refactoring

For TestRun class from models relationship for test sets via
association_proxy() function was established. It is need because of some
cleaning actions that are performed in standalone TestRun methods by
nose plugin which consume data that is stored in test sets objects.
Unit tests (except those for REST controllers) were updated.
Some additional non-major refactoring was performed.

Change-Id: I94ef205ee6d90426929746573c836f4de7cc7b24

commit_message:
Openstack DbaaS(Database as a Service)/Trove resource

This is patch-1 in the two patch series to implement trove
(DBaaS) resource. This patch adds troveclient to requirements
and updates clients.py to get trove client.

Blueprint dbaas-trove-resource

Change-Id: I7f8b3fad2b47db4ef14686ce9c94955144211c3c

commit_message:
Set Nova auth_proto regardless of tls-proxy.

We actually want to comment out the keystone auth_proto in Nova's
api-paste.ini file regardless of the tls-proxy setting. Likewise
lets always set it in nova.conf as well.

This should fix an issue in trying to get this in:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52825/

Change-Id: I1b8202aa1666cbb6ca13d2f77d50fa0175969266

commit_message:
Add Pcloud Flavors

This change introduces the basic framework for creating and managing
pclouds flavors (Host Flavors), which can be used by users to add such
hosts to the Pcloud.

Partly implements blueprint:  whole-host-allocation

Change-Id: Ib45b1f887b576f612ee184584667df48627fb3d3

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2013-08-18 18:58:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'FWaaS - Firewall Commit Operation Support

This patch introduces a commit operation for the FWaaS firewall.

The commit operation is used to apply changes in rules/policy to
a particular firewall.

There is no change in CRUD semantics for all FWaaS resources including
firewall. Changes to rules/policies will be reflected immediately in
the database (but will not be applied to any associated firewalls
until a commit operation is performed on a particular firewall).

firewall_rule and firewall_policy have a new readonly attribute
update_timestamp.

firewall resource has the following new readonly attributes:
* commit_timestamp
* committed_rules
* policy_modified_commit_required (boolean, this indicates whether the
committed rules on the firewal are in sync with the current state of
the policy).

blueprint neutron-fwaas-explicit-commit

Change-Id: Ib11d90ec46b7497401d89fcdc65f2d8b10d682b2

commit_message:
FWaaS - Firewall Commit Operation Support

This patch introduces a commit operation for the FWaaS firewall.

The commit operation is used to apply changes in rules/policy to
a particular firewall.

There is no change in CRUD semantics for all FWaaS resources including
firewall. Changes to rules/policies will be reflected immediately in
the database (but will not be applied to any associated firewalls
until a commit operation is performed on a particular firewall).

firewall_rule and firewall_policy have a new readonly attribute
update_timestamp.

firewall resource has the following new readonly attributes:
* commit_timestamp
* committed_rules
* policy_modified_commit_required (boolean, this indicates whether the
committed rules on the firewal are in sync with the current state of
the policy).

The associated CLI change is in the following patch:
https://review.openstack.org/43249

blueprint neutron-fwaas-explicit-commit

Change-Id: Ib11d90ec46b7497401d89fcdc65f2d8b10d682b2

subject: Debian consitency and links
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-02 12:54:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Debian consitency and links

This patch reviews the "Answer to the debconf" things in
every service, so that they look the same. It also adds
links to the debconf chapter, so that users can navigate
more easily in the doc. Lastly, it also changes the
titles of the debconf chapter so that they match the
text in each chapter. Finally, this patch documents the
fact that python-argparse should be installed manually
on all Wheezy setups, which is an issue that has been
reported by some users, and which wasn't documented.

Change-Id: I5a85f39e49786ae90cc0afbf13b94baf486408f4
backport: havana
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-11-02 14:44:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Debian consitency and links

This patch reviews the "Answer to the debconf" things in
every service, so that they look the same.

It also adds links to the debconf chapter, so that users
can navigate more easily in the doc.

It also changes the titles of the debconf chapter so that
they match the text in each chapter.

It also documents the fact that python-argparse should be
installed manually on all Wheezy setups, which is an issue
that has been reported by some users, and which wasn't
documented.

The patch also extends the explanations about the
meta-packages.

Finally, the patch also moves the explanation about remote
MySQL setup from the nova installation procedure to the
debconf-dbconfig-common section of the debconf chapter,
which is a much better fit.

This is my last clean-up work, I believe.

Change-Id: I5a85f39e49786ae90cc0afbf13b94baf486408f4
backport: havana

they match the text in each chapter.

It also documents the fact that python-argparse should be
installed manually on all Wheezy setups, which is an issue
that has been reported by some users, and which wasn't
documented.

The patch also extends the explanations about the
meta-packages.

This patch adds a lot of <informalfigure> tags that were
missing as well.

Finally, the patch also moves the explanation about remote
MySQL setup from the nova installation procedure to the
debconf-dbconfig-common section of the debconf chapter,
which is a much better fit.

This is my last clean-up work, I believe.

Change-Id: I5a85f39e49786ae90cc0afbf13b94baf486408f4
backport: havana
', 'number': 10}]
commit_message:
Debian consitency and links

This patch reviews the "Answer to the debconf" things in
every service, so that they look the same.

It also adds links to the debconf chapter, so that users
can navigate more easily in the doc.

It also changes the titles of the debconf chapter so that
they match the text in each chapter.

It also documents the fact that python-argparse should be
installed manually on all Wheezy setups, which is an issue
that has been reported by some users, and which wasn't
documented.

The patch also extends the explanations about the
meta-packages.

This patch adds a lot of <informalfigure> tags that were
missing as well.

Finally, the patch also moves the explanation about remote
MySQL setup from the nova installation procedure to the
debconf-dbconfig-common section of the debconf chapter,
which is a much better fit.

This is my last clean-up work, I believe.

Change-Id: I5a85f39e49786ae90cc0afbf13b94baf486408f4
backport: havana

commit_message:
Fixing availability-zone not take effect error

when create a availability-zone, add a host to the aggregate,
then boot an instance in the host, "OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone"
property can not show correctly in time when using "nova show
<server>". The cause is that nova does not update the cache in
time, so should change this to avoid getting old cache.

Closes-bug: #1240374

Change-Id: I2466752912ee030be55776988bfabb40cf3e94b5

subject: Revert default ceilometer storage driver to mongodb
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 15:09:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceilometer', 'stack.sh'], 'message': 'Revert default ceilometer storage driver to mongodb

Previously, this was changed to sqlalchemy in order to avoid
an issue with ceilometer requiring mongodb-server >= 2.4.x.

Now, an appropriate version of mongodb is available from the
cloud archive, so we enable this as an additional repository.

Change-Id: I62ce8d8569b123618688f101575615c7ec7914cd
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert default ceilometer storage driver to mongodb

Previously, this was changed to sqlalchemy in order to avoid
an issue with ceilometer requiring mongodb-server >= 2.4.x.

Now, an appropriate version of mongodb is available from the
cloud archive, so we enable this as an additional repository.

Change-Id: I62ce8d8569b123618688f101575615c7ec7914cd

commit_message:
Add auth_token settings to nova.conf.sample.

Updates our example config file so that it includes configuration
settings for the auth_token middleware.

Includes the latest generate_sample.sh from Oslo.

Related-Bug: #1240753

Change-Id: I393a67f1f005e775928130c9241aa7e25c391ae3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-26 01:18:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix `NoopQuotaDriver.get_(project|user)_quotas` format

The quota API extension expects `get_project_quotas` and `get_user_quotas` to
return a dictionary where the value is another dictionary with a `limit` key.

The `DbQuotaDriver` adhered to this spec, but the `NoopQuotaDriver` didn't.

This fixes the `NoopQuotaDriver` to return the results in the correct format.

Fixes bug 1244842

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-11-01 18:45:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_quota.py', 'nova/quota.py'], 'message': "Fix `NoopQuotaDriver.get_(project|user)_quotas` format

The quota API extension expects `get_project_quotas` and `get_user_quotas` to
return a dictionary where the value is another dictionary with a `limit` key.

The `DbQuotaDriver` adhered to this spec, but the `NoopQuotaDriver` didn't.

This fixes the `NoopQuotaDriver` to return the results in the correct format.

Fixes bug 1244842

Change-Id: Iea274dab1c3f10c3cb0a2815f431e15b4d4934b1

commit_message:
Fix `NoopQuotaDriver.get_(project|user)_quotas` format

The quota API extension expects `get_project_quotas` and `get_user_quotas` to
return a dictionary where the value is another dictionary with a `limit` key.

The `DbQuotaDriver` adhered to this spec, but the `NoopQuotaDriver` didn't.

This fixes the `NoopQuotaDriver` to return the results in the correct format.

Fixes bug 1244842

Change-Id: Iea274dab1c3f10c3cb0a2815f431e15b4d4934b1

commit_message:
Remove multipath mapping device descriptor

When detaching a volume from a instance, we need to remove
multipath mapping device descriptor if there are other volumes
mapping to the host instead of do nothing, for some cinder drivers
can not terminate connection for multipath tool sending IOs to
storage array periodically.

Closes-bug: #1223975
Change-Id: I6fc02e045146ece49162ca6be1a83fa8d0214a0a

subject: Fix unit tests.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-04 18:41:44.000000000', 'files': ['swift/proxy/controllers/container.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "Fix unit tests.

Turns out that if a test module's setup() function fails, tox silently
ignores the failures.

There was a bug where the test storage policies were being ignored by
the container controller, thus causing
test.unit.proxy.test_server.setup() to fail. The bug has been fixed.

Change-Id: I73a6f9ad3b1e2d7198d6a7fc67a0fbfd9116d684
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests.

Turns out that if a test module's setup() function fails, tox silently
ignores the failures.

There was a bug where the test storage policies were being ignored by
the container controller, thus causing
test.unit.proxy.test_server.setup() to fail. The bug has been fixed.

Change-Id: I73a6f9ad3b1e2d7198d6a7fc67a0fbfd9116d684

commit_message:
Add a better installer for local Barbican application instances.

The current local installer (bin/barbican-all) requires that users
perform several steps before hand. The new installer seeks to minimize
the amount of manual steps needed.

Change-Id: Ie5d74331028fa7c463f53bed92a504771c09a385
Implements: blueprint add-local-installer-script

commit_message:
Fix deprecation warning.

BaseException.message is deprecated; if you have an exception of type
Exception (or subclass thereof), then "str(ex)" is the preferred way
to get the message.

Change-Id: I5b4acf88de538c1ef0f2db4fefaa92699937cd50

This patch reviews the installation procedure for Cinder
in the Debian install-guide. It also moves the part which
explains how to setup the volume group on top of the
procedure, since that's ok for all operating systems, and
that's needed for Debian (a volume group must be present
before installing cinder-volume, otherwise it will not
be detected automatically, which adds more manual work).

explains how to setup the volume group on top of the
procedure, since that's ok for all operating systems, and
that's needed for Debian (a volume group must be present
before installing cinder-volume, otherwise it will not
be detected automatically, which adds more manual work).

Change-Id: I84914a3447664f70e0c5678f0445b9385ae3b8c8

commit_message:
Specifics for Debian install of Cinder

This patch reviews the installation procedure for Cinder
in the Debian install-guide. It also moves the part which
explains how to setup the volume group on top of the
procedure, since that's ok for all operating systems, and
that's needed for Debian (a volume group must be present
before installing cinder-volume, otherwise it will not
be detected automatically, which adds more manual work).

Change-Id: I84914a3447664f70e0c5678f0445b9385ae3b8c8
backport: havana

commit_message:
Install Guide: Clarify package installation

Clarify the package installation so that it's clear that the
instructions should be complete and no further tweaking is needed.

backport: havana

This is part of blueprint assertequal

"test_" methods

BaseNetworkTest
	BaseSecGroupTest
		SecGroupTest
		NegativeSecGroupTest

subject: Add colon after service name
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 23:37:18.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Add colon after service name

In Fedora 21 the log format changed from this:

Oct 10 23:54:20 rhev-a24c-01 proxy-server 10.10.55.128 .....

to this:

Oct 10 23:57:49 kvm-rei journal: proxy-server 192.168.128.11 .....

It is clearly incompatible, because the word "journal:" is added.

It happens because all the log messages are filtered by Systemd
and it adds "journal:" if it cannot find a word ending with colon.
See:
 https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1018042

It seems that one simple fix could be in Swift. We already add
the indentifier word, it's just we do not end it in colon.
Therefore, we could start adding a colon to make the log look
more like any other system log.

Unfortunately, this is not entirely compatible either! The number
of words is kept, so if you parse with regexp, you get the things
in expected places, but the name of the server now has a colon.
Would be simple enough to fix, I suppose, but still, this needs
a consideration. Reviewers should feel free to put -1 or -2 on
this if they find an application that breaks with this patch.

Change-Id: I0d641ae49e6fc989283868ade2ca542a8133cb07
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add colon after service name

In Fedora 21 the log format changed from this:

Oct 10 23:54:20 rhev-a24c-01 proxy-server 10.10.55.128 .....

to this:

Oct 10 23:57:49 kvm-rei journal: proxy-server 192.168.128.11 .....

It is clearly incompatible, because the word "journal:" is added.

It happens because all the log messages are filtered by Systemd
and it adds "journal:" if it cannot find a word ending with colon.
See:
 https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1018042

It seems that one simple fix could be in Swift. We already add
the indentifier word, it's just we do not end it in colon.
Therefore, we could start adding a colon to make the log look
more like any other system log.

Unfortunately, this is not entirely compatible either! The number
of words is kept, so if you parse with regexp, you get the things
in expected places, but the name of the server now has a colon.
Would be simple enough to fix, I suppose, but still, this needs
a consideration. Reviewers should feel free to put -1 or -2 on
this if they find an application that breaks with this patch.

Change-Id: I0d641ae49e6fc989283868ade2ca542a8133cb07

commit_message:
Implements client and tests for Ceilometer V2 api.

Components covered: nova, glance, swift and neutron.
Ceilometer entities coverage: samples, meters, resources, statistics
TODO: alarms, sample posting, advanced nova meters.

Implements: blueprint Add basic tests for Ceilometer
(https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/add-basic-ceilometer-tests)

Change-Id: I1f20556454145ba203b925a25ec57f6ea05dd112

commit_message:
Fix parsiong of network provider

Patch include fixes:
* Change uri for parsing network_provider
* For create instance method add create_kargs parameter
  with specified network id
* Fix pep8 issues

Fixes bug/1247230 bug/1247082

The context arg was added to the compute driver's destroy() method in
commit 8c0673d3102478ef34ef1b11c1db156db4b68f62.  The context is used by
the libvirt driver when dealing with encrypted volumes.

Unfortunately, most of the places where this method is called in the
compute manager, the context wasn't being passed in.  This patch makes
the argument mandatory and updates all of the drivers to match.

Change-Id: Icea2a36c16869af43954065473ff4e4910f32b1e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Always pass context to compute driver destroy()

The context arg was added to the compute driver's destroy() method in
commit 8c0673d3102478ef34ef1b11c1db156db4b68f62.  The context is used by
the libvirt driver when dealing with encrypted volumes.

Unfortunately, most of the places where this method is called in the
compute manager, the context wasn't being passed in.  This patch makes
the argument mandatory and updates all of the drivers to match.

Change-Id: Icea2a36c16869af43954065473ff4e4910f32b1e

subject: Delete temporary files used in tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-01 02:58:25.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy.py', 'tests/unit/db/test_api.py', 'tests/unit/test_fileutils.py'], 'message': 'Delete temporary files used in tests

We use temporary files created by fileutils.write_to_tempfile.
but never delete them. They are left in system after running test
cases. User of mkstemp() is responsible for deleting the temporary
file when done with it.
See http://docs.python.org/2/library/tempfile.html#tempfile.mkstemp

Change-Id: I809f05286f3233c2f6e040b544f870cba20497f9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Delete temporary files used in tests

We use temporary files created by fileutils.write_to_tempfile.
but never delete them. They are left in system after running test
cases. User of mkstemp() is responsible for deleting the temporary
file when done with it.
See http://docs.python.org/2/library/tempfile.html#tempfile.mkstemp

Change-Id: I809f05286f3233c2f6e040b544f870cba20497f9

commit_message:
Adds locking to completion caches

Previously, completion caches were not thread-safe and multiple
threads could not make calls to python-novaclient simultaneously.
With locking, the completion caches are now thread-safe.

Closes-Bug: #1213958
Change-Id: I201c2ed0f1eb09b1c2a74de96119cbae9ed6f4b0

commit_message:
add debugging for when changes-sinces fails

this test fails about once a month, even in it's current format.
It's hard to tell why at this point, so put in enough debugging so
that the next failure will let us understand what's going on.

Change-Id: I95b91faeea70536f6f4d5226cf6ebda20b93412d

subject: Expose option to set libvirt nic driver.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-31 17:31:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use the virtio libvirt driver instead of e1000.

Using the virtio libvirt driver for network interfaces results in much
better network performance between vm's.  Local testing indicates the
disk deployment by nova-baremetal-deploy-helper going from around 4
minutes to 1 minute after switching to virtio.  I did not do any more
extensive testing or gathering of hard data, but in general virtio is
just known to be quicker than e1000 emulation for the network
interface.

Change-Id: I4af35be6dd96fbd3201adac25a6e03bf5ecc712d
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-11-01 15:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/create-nodes', 'scripts/configure-vm', 'scripts/boot-seed-vm', 'scripts/devtest.sh'], 'message': "Expose option to set libvirt nic driver.

This commit adds an environment variable, $LIBVIRT_NIC_DRIVER, that
can be set to override the default e1000 driver.  Using the virtio
libvirt driver for network interfaces results in much better network
performance between vm's.  Local testing indicates the disk deployment
by nova-baremetal-deploy-helper going from around 4 minutes to 1
minute after switching to virtio.

virtio may be unstable on Ubuntu, see comments in
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=910619 for more details.

Change-Id: I4af35be6dd96fbd3201adac25a6e03bf5ecc712d
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Expose option to set libvirt nic driver.

This commit adds an environment variable, $LIBVIRT_NIC_DRIVER, that
can be set to override the default e1000 driver.  Using the virtio
libvirt driver for network interfaces results in much better network
performance between vm's.  Local testing indicates the disk deployment
by nova-baremetal-deploy-helper going from around 4 minutes to 1
minute after switching to virtio.

virtio may be unstable on Ubuntu, see comments in
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=910619 for more details.

Change-Id: I4af35be6dd96fbd3201adac25a6e03bf5ecc712d

commit_message:
Add wrapper for keystone service catalog

This patch designed for receiving url of any
openstack service from keystone service catalog.
Examples: Ironic conductor and api are on different
hosts, conductor needs api url for deploy image,
get Glance service api for Ironic.

Change-Id: I3dc7475e10c7a464541be64d69ce97c41be7a650

subject: Adopt 0.1.8 as iso8601 minimum version
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 18:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pip-requires'], 'message': 'Adopt 0.1.8 as iso8601 minimum version

In the images api, we depend on iso8601 to parse some dates and times.
Recently, since version 0.1.4, python-iso8601 added support for a few
more formats, and we finally got some other issues nailed down by 0.1.8.
If end user switch from 0.1.8 back to 0.1.4 in the deployment, the image
api will lose support for certain datetime formats like YYYY-MM-DD
(where the time part is assumed to be all zeros). This obviously creates
a compatibility concern.

We were resolved to make glance compatible with both iso 0.1.4 and
0.1.8, but it appears that to do so requires essentially reimplementing
a large swath of iso8601 0.1.8 in glance itself.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Change-Id: Iece0116d3c412216251e2d7fbffe10bfe2c1c789
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adopt 0.1.8 as iso8601 minimum version

In the images api, we depend on iso8601 to parse some dates and times.
Recently, since version 0.1.4, python-iso8601 added support for a few
more formats, and we finally got some other issues nailed down by 0.1.8.
If end user switch from 0.1.8 back to 0.1.4 in the deployment, the image
api will lose support for certain datetime formats like YYYY-MM-DD
(where the time part is assumed to be all zeros). This obviously creates
a compatibility concern.

We were resolved to make glance compatible with both iso 0.1.4 and
0.1.8, but it appears that to do so requires essentially reimplementing
a large swath of iso8601 0.1.8 in glance itself.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Change-Id: Iece0116d3c412216251e2d7fbffe10bfe2c1c789
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add configurable timeout for ovs-vsctl

Enables the user to update the timeout. The default is 2.
0 will wait forever.

Change-Id: I048ccf0133843a1580e18e570a0d5194f1f41635
Closes-Bug: #1239889

subject: glance-replicator: decode metadata dictionary to unicode recursively
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 2069, 'name': 'Yufang Zhang', 'email': 'yufang521247@gmail.com', 'username': 'yufang521247'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4463, 'name': 'iccha-sethi', 'email': 'iccha.sethi@rackspace.com', 'username': 'iccha-sethi'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 6493, 'name': 'John Bresnahan', 'email': 'john@bresnahan.me', 'username': 'jbresnah'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 08:09:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'glance-replicator: decode metadata dictionary to str recursively

bug 1213822

When syncing images across different datacenters via glance-relicator,
some images' metadatas are always updated to the slave glance, even it
has already been synced before. The problem lies in here:

log output:
metadata diff -- value differs for key properties: master "{u'vm_mode': u'hvm'}"
vs slave "{'vm_mode': 'hvm'}"
... metadata has changed

......

On doing image compare, glance-replicator gets image metadatas from both master
and slave. Then it try to do a 'diff' for these metadatas. If the metadatas are
different according to the diff result, metadatas from the master are updated
to the slave. The _dict_diff() function are responsible for doing metadate
comparing. It translate the metadata dictionary to str before doing compare, but
it doesn't handle the situation when metadata dictionary has sub-dictionary.

This patch fixes this problem by decoding metadata dictionary to str recursively
before doing diff, so that sub-dictionary items could also be translated to str.

Change-Id: Ibdcb0c3e770495d8847d57a03b73e8f20b0337de
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-19 08:11:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'glance-replicator: decode metadata dictionary to str recursively

bug 1213822

When syncing images across different datacenters via glance-relicator,
some images' metadatas are always updated to the slave glance, even it
has already been synced before. The problem lies in here:

log output:
metadata diff -- value differs for key properties: master "{u'vm_mode': u'hvm'}"
vs slave "{'vm_mode': 'hvm'}"
... metadata has changed

On doing image compare, glance-replicator gets image metadatas from both master
and slave. Then it try to do a 'diff' for these metadatas. If the metadatas are
different according to the diff result, metadatas from the master are updated
to the slave. The _dict_diff() function are responsible for doing metadate
comparing. It translate the metadata dictionary to str before doing compare, but
it doesn't handle the situation when metadata dictionary has sub-dictionary.

This patch fixes this problem by decoding metadata dictionary to str recursively
before doing diff, so that sub-dictionary items could also be translated to str.

Change-Id: Ibdcb0c3e770495d8847d57a03b73e8f20b0337de
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-08-19 09:44:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'glance-replicator: decode metadata dictionary to str recursively

bug 1213822

When syncing images across different datacenters via glance-relicator,
some images' metadatas are always updated to the slave glance, even it

log output:
metadata diff -- value differs for key properties: master "{u'vm_mode': u'hvm'}"
vs slave "{'vm_mode': 'hvm'}"
... metadata has changed

On doing image compare, glance-replicator gets image metadatas from both master
and slave. Then it try to do a 'diff' for these metadatas. If the metadatas are
different according to the diff result, metadatas from the master are updated
to the slave. The _dict_diff() function are responsible for doing metadate
comparing. It translate the metadata dictionary to str before doing compare, but
it doesn't handle the situation when metadata dictionary has sub-dictionary.

This patch fixes this problem by decoding metadata dictionary to str recursively
before doing diff, so that sub-dictionary items could also be translated to str.

commit_message:
glance-replicator: decode metadata dictionary to unicode recursively

When syncing images across different datacenters via glance-relicator,
some images' metadatas are always updated to the slave glance, even it
has already been synced before. The problem lies in here:

log output:
metadata diff -- value differs for key properties: master "{u'vm_mode': u'hvm'}"
vs slave "{'vm_mode': 'hvm'}"
... metadata has changed

On doing image compare, glance-replicator gets image metadatas from both master
and slave. Then it try to do a 'diff' for these metadatas. If the metadatas are
different according to the diff result, metadatas from the master are updated
to the slave. The _dict_diff() function are responsible for doing metadata
comparing. It translate the metadata dictionary to str before doing compare, but
it doesn't handle the situation when metadata dictionary has sub-dictionary.

This patch fixes this problem by decoding metadata dictionary to unicode recursively
before doing diff, so that sub-dictionary items could also be translated to unicode.

bug 1213822

Change-Id: Ibdcb0c3e770495d8847d57a03b73e8f20b0337de

subject: Ensure use of normalized x-timestamp value in APIs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 2696, 'name': 'Darrell Bishop', 'email': 'dbishop@nvidia.com', 'username': 'darrellb'}, {'_account_id': 6198, 'name': 'Peter Portante', 'email': 'peter.a.portante@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter-a-portante'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-28 17:19:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure use of normalized x-timestamp value in APIs

As a follow up to the DELETE timestamp bug (see
https://review.openstack.org/40643 and
https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1196932) the timestamp checks
are not always compared properly, where a given request can provide a
timestamp that, as a float, is newer or older than an already
stored-on-disk timestamp, but lexically "newer" or "older" than that
timestamp.

FIXME: add a unit test for the above

We address this by requiring all X-Timestamp headers to be in
normalize_timestamp() format (11.5), rejecting the request if they are
not, and we change the DatabaseBroker API to also require normalized
timestamps.

FIXME: go back and remove the use of float, normalizing values from
       metadata

FIXME: line wrap test_server.py modules

This change creates the request_timestamp() method in the
request_helpers module to unify the checking and validation of the
X-Timestamp header, returning it as a float. All the references to
X-Timestamp from headers have been modified to use this method.

Additional changes:

  Account Server:

    in DELETE, moved x-timestamp check before mount check so that we
    validate parameters before we touch file systems; this is also the
    case for the POST method

    AccountBroker.delete_db() is now passed a raw float instead of
    whatever is in the request header.

  Container Server:

    All uses of the request header timestamp have been changed to
    float, and the db module interfaces have been updated to accept
    a float handling the normalization there.

  Object Server:

    All uses of the request header timestamp have been changed to get
    their value from the request_timestamp() helper method. All
    x-timestamp attributes in the metadata are normalized to ensure
    their proper use.

  common/constraints.py:

    check_float() was removed, it is no longer used

  common/db.py:

    All DatabaseBroker interfaces used by the account and container
    server code that accept timestamps now ensure they are normalized
    since the servers unmarshall them from the request header as a
    float.

Change-Id: Ifc1d1d3d82730b1581c08aeea6fc7745b3fc3fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-28 17:32:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure use of normalized x-timestamp value in APIs

Certain REST APIs require the existence of the X-Timestamp
header. Since all of them use the almost identical sequence, we
refactor those blocks of code into one request helper method, removing
the duplication, and enhance that new method to report additional
error conditions (must be a normalized timestamp and must be
non-negative).

This change creates the request_timestamp() method in the
request_helpers module to unify the checking and validation of the
X-Timestamp header, returning it as a float. All the references to
X-Timestamp from headers have been modified to use this method.

Additional changes:

  Account Server:

    In DELETE, moved x-timestamp check before mount check so that we
    validate parameters before we touch file systems; this is
    currently the case for the POST method

  common/constraints.py:

    check_float() was removed, it is no longer used

commit_message:
Ensure use of normalized x-timestamp value in APIs

Certain REST APIs require the existence of the X-Timestamp
header. Since all of them use the almost identical sequence, we
refactor those blocks of code into one request helper method, removing
the duplication, and enhance that new method to report additional
error conditions (must be a normalized timestamp and must be
non-negative).

This change creates the request_timestamp() method in the
request_helpers module to unify the checking and validation of the
X-Timestamp header, returning it as a float. All the references to
X-Timestamp from headers have been modified to use this method.

Additional changes:

  Account Server:

    In DELETE, moved x-timestamp check before mount check so that we
    validate parameters before we touch file systems; this is
    currently the case for the POST method

    In PUT, we only verify the timestamp using the new
    request_timestamp method for the external API path, adding an
    explicit parameter check for the other headers for the internal
    "PUT account container" REST API.

  common/constraints.py:

    check_float() was removed, it is no longer used

Change-Id: Ifc1d1d3d82730b1581c08aeea6fc7745b3fc3fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change all non-slow scenario tests to smoke

Smoke test should be able to check the integrity of the OpenStack cloud
environment easily. And the scenario tests should cover the popular use
cases.
So I think scenario tests should also be executed as smoke tests.
This commit changes all non-slow scenario tests to smoke.

Change-Id: Ia08c7dcec20501a5086e2078439076eeac234cff

commit_message:
add tests for show and update of Flavor Extra Spec API extension

this adds positive and negative  tests for show and update actions
of FlavorExtra Spec API extension.
this checks the extends response attribute that added by all flavor
extension API.
this also move some translation from xml to json into the xml flavor
client, so tests can use xml client and json client in the same way.

Change-Id: I0cf47640a61da8a062ea14b49554911cab8b3be7

subject: scenario cross_tenant_connectivity
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-03 19:30:40.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_cross_tenant_connectivity.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/api/network/common.py'], 'message': 'scenario cross_tenant_connectivity

This test suite assumes that Nova has been configured to boot VM's with
Neutron-managed networking, and attempts to verify cross tenant connectivity
as follows

ssh:
    in order to overcome "ip namespace", each tenant has an "access point"  VM
    with floating-ip open to incoming ssh connection allowing network commands
    (ping/ssh) to be executed from within the tenant-network-namespace
    Tempest host performs key-based authentication to the ssh server via
    floating IP address

setup:
    for each tenant (demo and alt):
        1. create a network&subnet
        2. create a router (if public router isn't configured)
        3. connect tenant network to public network via router
        4. create an access point:
            a. a security group open to incoming ssh connection
            b. a VM with a floating ip
        5. for demo tenant - create another server to test in-tenant connections

connectivity test is done by pinging destination server via source server ssh
connection.
success - ping returns
failure - ping_timeout reached

tests:
        1. _verify_network_details
        2. _verify_mac_addr: for each access point verify that
        (subnet, fix_ip, mac address) are as defined in the port list
        3. _test_in_tenant_block: test that in-tenant traffic is disabled
        without rules allowing it
        4. _test_in_tenant_allow: test that in-tenant traffic is enabled once an
        appropriate rule has been created
        5. _test_cross_tenant_block: test that cross-tenant traffic is disabled
        without a rule allowing it on destination tenant
        6. _test_cross_tenant_allow:
            * test that cross-tenant traffic is enabled once an appropriate rule
            has been created on destination tenant.
            * test that reverse traffic is still blocked
            * test than revesre traffic is enabled once an appropriate
            * rule has been created on source tenant

assumptions:
        1. alt_tenant/user existed and is different from demo_tenant/user
        2. Public network is defined and reachable from the Tempest host
        3. Public router can either be:
            * defined, in which case all tenants networks can connect directly
            to it, and cross tenant check will be done on the private IP of the
            destination tenant
            or
            * not defined (empty string), in which case each tanant will have
            its own router connected to the public network

helper changes:

manager:
    1. move network and router creation to mananger
    (from scenario/test_network_basic_ops)
    2. add set_resource=True to _create_secgroup_rule() so you can create a rule
    not deleted by tearDown this is workaround for bug 1247568 in
    python-neutronclient (preventing tearDownClass from ignoring deleted neutron
    resources

Change-Id: I9c5d8795c2cc08e9ebd836c58919c811aa3abe80
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
scenario cross_tenant_connectivity

This test suite assumes that Nova has been configured to boot VM's with
Neutron-managed networking, and attempts to verify cross tenant connectivity
as follows

ssh:
    in order to overcome "ip namespace", each tenant has an "access point"  VM
    with floating-ip open to incoming ssh connection allowing network commands
    (ping/ssh) to be executed from within the tenant-network-namespace
    Tempest host performs key-based authentication to the ssh server via
    floating IP address

setup:
    for each tenant (demo and alt):
        1. create a network&subnet
        2. create a router (if public router isn't configured)
        3. connect tenant network to public network via router
        4. create an access point:
            a. a security group open to incoming ssh connection
            b. a VM with a floating ip
        5. for demo tenant - create another server to test in-tenant connections

connectivity test is done by pinging destination server via source server ssh
connection.
success - ping returns
failure - ping_timeout reached

tests:
        1. _verify_network_details
        2. _verify_mac_addr: for each access point verify that
        (subnet, fix_ip, mac address) are as defined in the port list
        3. _test_in_tenant_block: test that in-tenant traffic is disabled
        without rules allowing it
        4. _test_in_tenant_allow: test that in-tenant traffic is enabled once an
        appropriate rule has been created
        5. _test_cross_tenant_block: test that cross-tenant traffic is disabled
        without a rule allowing it on destination tenant
        6. _test_cross_tenant_allow:
            * test that cross-tenant traffic is enabled once an appropriate rule
            has been created on destination tenant.
            * test that reverse traffic is still blocked
            * test than revesre traffic is enabled once an appropriate
            * rule has been created on source tenant

assumptions:
        1. alt_tenant/user existed and is different from demo_tenant/user
        2. Public network is defined and reachable from the Tempest host
        3. Public router can either be:
            * defined, in which case all tenants networks can connect directly
            to it, and cross tenant check will be done on the private IP of the
            destination tenant
            or
            * not defined (empty string), in which case each tanant will have
            its own router connected to the public network

helper changes:

manager:
    1. move network and router creation to mananger
    (from scenario/test_network_basic_ops)
    2. add set_resource=True to _create_secgroup_rule() so you can create a rule
    not deleted by tearDown this is workaround for bug 1247568 in
    python-neutronclient (preventing tearDownClass from ignoring deleted neutron
    resources

Change-Id: I9c5d8795c2cc08e9ebd836c58919c811aa3abe80

commit_message:
Parted 'invalid option' in XenAPI driver

/sbin/parted is throwing an 'invalid option' error when setting the
partition endpoint to -0 (which tells parted to extend the partition
to the end of the disk). This change adds '--' to indicate the
remaining args are not options.

Fixes bug 1247307

Change-Id: I3bd2e25404d002329aa0ea53e9b60b69c90c0adb

subject: Fix setting backdoor port in service start

[{'created': '2013-10-30 18:55:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/service.py'], 'message': "Fix setting backdoor port in service start

Previously if self.manager wasn't defined for a Service object but a
backdoor_port was specified then that particular service would not
start because it would try to set the backdoor port in an object that
didn't exist. This commit fixes setting the backdoor port only if
manager is defined when calling start().

Closes-Bug: #1243260

Change-Id: Ib0e709cfd0e299a3e010450b7eba6e92bc108e4e
(cherry picked from commit e5c96505c0b4eac51c0925dcb691f0a1699216ce)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix setting backdoor port in service start

Previously if self.manager wasn't defined for a Service object but a
backdoor_port was specified then that particular service would not
start because it would try to set the backdoor port in an object that
didn't exist. This commit fixes setting the backdoor port only if
manager is defined when calling start().

Closes-Bug: #1243260

Change-Id: Ib0e709cfd0e299a3e010450b7eba6e92bc108e4e
(cherry picked from commit e5c96505c0b4eac51c0925dcb691f0a1699216ce)

commit_message:
Avoid suppressing underlying error when deploy.loadapp fails

Raise log level at the first load attempt. If there is a
fundamental problem with the environment, a Lookup error
is not helpful in troubleshooting the problem further.

Fix bug 1210236

(cherry picked from commit: 696e9f3fc8ef7e8bd2a8f21071f3ef91fac14ad5)

Change-Id: I55aa11a0e5a37dbef3f0c1b55aa4c9c11bbf55d9

subject: Enable create volume on force hosts
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-03 13:39:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volume_metadata.py', 'etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample', 'cinder/volume/flows/create_volume/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/scheduler/host_manager.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volume_metadata.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/stubs.py', 'cinder/tests/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v1/test_snapshot_metadata.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_snapshot_metadata.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v1/stubs.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Enable create volume on force hosts

Cinder scheduler will help select host for create request based on
scheduler filters, but end user cannot create volume directly on a
force host.

This patch enhanced the option of "--availability-zone" for "cinder
create" to provide force hosts option. If end user specify
"--availability-zone zone1:host1", this means that customer want to
create the volume on force host host1.

Implements bp cinder-force-host

Change-Id: I76311d7f99e1bcd3515a78b37cae1c0bfc2fb972
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable create volume on force hosts

Cinder scheduler will help select host for create request based on
scheduler filters, but end user cannot create volume directly on a
force host.

This patch enhanced the option of "--availability-zone" for "cinder
create" to provide force hosts option. If end user specify
"--availability-zone zone1:host1", this means that customer want to
create the volume on force host host1.

Implements bp cinder-force-host

Change-Id: I76311d7f99e1bcd3515a78b37cae1c0bfc2fb972

commit_message:
Fixes the destroy() method for the Docker virt driver

* Added the missing "context" argument in nova/virt/driver.py
* Added the missing argument in the test_virt_drivers.destroy() as well so it
will make sure none of the other drivers will miss it.

Change-Id: I083b935da95c28ad4f9879036ef2bf7c1fbbb58e
Closes-Bug: #1244829

commit_message:
VMware: fix bug for reporting instance UUID's

Ensure that the correct UUID's are reported to the compute
manager. The fix will return only valid UUID's and not all
of the names of the instances running.

Closes-Bug: #1237795

Change-Id: I32bb6f4783dcc80697abebd5a7f45ef9950a0896
(cherry picked from commit 74289aacb5363bd72b449580325a651117e5342d)

commit_message:
Adds a link to the Debian wiki

This patch adds a link to http://wiki.debian.org/OpenStack,
so that users know how to report bugs to the Debian BTS.
It also adds (Wheezy) to the Debian 7.0 titles.

Change-Id: I258f562314be49668f9fb921296c415be644e32b

commit_message:
Examine if GPFS is mounted before writing data.

If GPFS is not mounted, throw an exception and log the error message. That will
prevent create_volume(), copy_image_to_volume() or _clone_image() to create
file on local disk, which can not be removed by the driver code itself.

Change-Id: If5d4c7a88e82362d2a87068202926b1ca82d9dff
Closes-Bug: #1242511

commit_message:
Add notification on deleting instance without host

If an instance which does not have a host associated is deleted, the
corresponding notifications were not being sent. Fixed the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1211742

Change-Id: I56482ab38725e6f1ddfb14350637d329f35095b3
(cherry picked from commit bbab55c4da531e4695a6e3e577aaa4975f0fce79)

commit_message:
Sanitize passwords when logging payload in wsgi

adminPass (or admin_pass) can be either part of a json object or
an xml element or xml attribute. The patch includes
regexps to support all these cases and adds tests
as well

Change-Id: Ic119f986a03863c1d13b566b4c005f3bc77d83d0
Closes-Bug: 1231263
(cherry picked from commit c6d82083295e9b1b42f22d3a2d25a1ab7d341a13)

subject: Make unshelve use new style BDM
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-30 18:27:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Make unshelve use new style BDM

Unshelving an instance requires recreating it, and since change
I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea, it is necessary to call
compute manager's _prep_block_device with new style BDMs.

This patch makes the conductor return new-style BDMs when unshelving the
instance.

Closes-bug: 1246412
blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

Change-Id: I0ba9f53c31c4d5238319cfd09600ad64f298629e
(cherry picked from commit 7fb9fcc970324236267d893185b421e26b1cb1d9)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make unshelve use new style BDM

Unshelving an instance requires recreating it, and since change
I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea, it is necessary to call
compute manager's _prep_block_device with new style BDMs.

This patch makes the conductor return new-style BDMs when unshelving the
instance.

Closes-bug: 1246412
blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

Change-Id: I0ba9f53c31c4d5238319cfd09600ad64f298629e
(cherry picked from commit 7fb9fcc970324236267d893185b421e26b1cb1d9)

commit_message:
Fixes for LBaas documentation

   * Removed status from Health monitor
   * Added expect_codes, url_path, and http_method to response for Update and Create Monitor
   * Added status_description field to Pool, VIP, and Member tables

Also added another example to Update and create monitor and added status_description to samples for VIP, Pool, and Member.

Closes-Bug: #1213932

Change-Id: I07b1d3c2d0ff0decd11f999169462196be0d82df

commit_message:
Implement a v3 API extension to update user_data

This change allows user_data to be an attribute that can be updated
via the nova API server update call by adding update support to the
existing v3 os-user-data extension.

This will be used by Heat to deliver changed user data to servers
via the nova metadata API.

Partially implements blueprint update-userdata

Change-Id: Ic2fedc9b5c7d63cb19e72abd986ef6bd421de4aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 18:38:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Send delete.end with latest instance state

Delete.end notifications were getting sent with a blank deleted_at
field. This meant that services listening to notifications for
instance state changes could potentially never get the instances
deleted_at value. The instance usage audit notificaiton would be
the only source for that value.

This change returns the destroyed instance from the conductor API
and sends the delete.end notification with that state, containing
the deleted_at value which was just set.

Fixes bug 1241681

Change-Id: I3481e0bada1711c3bff50f249f6a2b40a4ea6855
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-18 20:08:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Send delete.end with latest instance state

Delete.end notifications were getting sent with a blank deleted_at
field. This meant that services listening to notifications for
instance state changes could potentially never get the instances
deleted_at value. The instance usage audit notificaiton would be
the only source for that value.

This change returns the destroyed instance from the conductor API
and sends the delete.end notification with that state, containing
the deleted_at value which was just set.

Fixes bug 1241681

Delete.end notifications were getting sent with a blank deleted_at
field. This meant that services listening to notifications for
instance state changes could potentially never get the instances
deleted_at value. The instance usage audit notification would be
the only source for that value.

This change returns the destroyed instance from the conductor API
and sends the delete.end notification with that state, containing
the deleted_at value which was just set.

Closes-Bug: #1241681

commit_message:
Send delete.end with latest instance state

Delete.end notifications were getting sent with a blank deleted_at
field. This meant that services listening to notifications for
instance state changes could potentially never get the instances
deleted_at value. The instance usage audit notification would be
the only source for that value.

This change returns the destroyed instance from the conductor API
and sends the delete.end notification with that state, containing
the deleted_at value which was just set.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1241681
Change-Id: I3481e0bada1711c3bff50f249f6a2b40a4ea6855

commit_message:
Add unit constants

There are lots of numeric expressions across some projects, such as
1024*1024 , 1024**3, 1000, 1000000 etc. This patch adds binary and
decimal unit constants and will sync into other projects. Replacing
nummeric experssions with these constants makes code more readable.

blueprint byte-unit-clean

Change-Id: I5093244f607d8c3a61a5f6b7ecbe657e5574b793

commit_message:
Corrections for Ceilometer setup on Compute node

- Correct package and service names for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
- Use <systemitem class="service"> instead of <literal> for service names.
- Removed redundant os profiling condition (os was set on both step and
  the screen element within the step).

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ibb75b26c7b943db616c0a0d759e9f9826f5bb2f9

It also adds (Wheezy) to the Debian 7.0 titles.

commit_message:
Pull system_metadata for notifications on instance.save()

When saving changes on an instance object a notification is sent out.
An attempt is made to pull flavor information from the instance but if
system_metadata is not joined then an exception is raised and the
notification fails.  This ensures that system_metadata is available for
those notifications.

Conflicts:

	nova/objects/base.py

The conflict is from change Icd2944f17b6100d51007dbc48da90e4e992bbd48

Change-Id: Ifd317f847c3839cd6019038bb3dc856b9f107000
Closes-bug: 1244311
(cherry picked from commit e03963b1e42ca2900b108201e77edf2386c5c46a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 17:19:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/ssc_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/iscsi.py'], 'message': 'NetApp fix ssc volume filtering inconsistency

This fixes the situation when the actual netapp
volume data structure becomes inconsistent
because of operating on the actual object
than the copy of it. It also introduces some checks
before calculating volume stats.

commit_message:
NetApp fix ssc volume filtering inconsistency

This fixes the situation when the actual netapp
volume data structure becomes inconsistent
because of operating on the actual object
than the copy of it. It also introduces some checks
before calculating volume stats.

Change-Id: I626f9ca9aa8c7cc41ba4aa6058f14cc040f7301f
Closes-Bug:#1243081
(cherry picked from commit 1d503937e841da27f5e3441775b2d208e44f5e75)

commit_message:
add dbus_service name for different platforms

on redhat6.4/centos, the dbus_service name is
messagebus, and on other platforms, it's dbus.
So I enhanced it, and updated the CHANGELOG.md
and metadata.rb .

Change-Id: I5548acc38b5e2cbf5e1d5d482cadbd876392daa4
Closes-Bug: #1244574

commit_message:
Adds basic plumbing for RESTful API service

This patch adds some basic plumbing for a Solum RESTful
API service. It uses the excellent and simple Falcon library
as its WSGI pipeline processing and route handling. Included
is a simple VersionsResource and a few serialization helpers
along with tests that cover all of the added code. Hoping that
this patch will spark some discussions around how to approach
building the API service.

Change-Id: Ide13035bd91c5a4f326ea980020e3b1aedecc92a

commit_message:
Adds a new debconf chapter

This patch adds a new debconf chapter in the Debian docs.
It describe generalities about the Debconf OpenStack. It
explains how the following is handled:
- Database config (using dbconfig-common)
- RabbitMQ config
- API endpoint registrations
- keystone_authtoken config
- preseeding

Also, a number of screenshots are added.

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ia5d8e5fc3d397f9441ecb50ef4a3458672307bdc
(cherry picked from commit c9728d9539752e828f88f4bec428e84346d28f47)

commit_message:
added new exception cinderclient.ConnectionError

Introduced new exception cinderclient.ConnectionError
with the change  I37da522e812286e72706409b8a6d4652515f720f.

Adding the exception cinderclient.ConnectionError to the
RECOVERABLE list solves the issues described in the
bug ##1207635.

fixes bug #1207635

Change-Id: I6b90343e79433fe554d84df1db65e096c8ed4423

subject: Fix status_code not passed in code
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-28 23:44:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/v2_0/client.py'], 'message': 'Fix status_code not passed in code

The python-neutronclient was refactored to raise NeutronClientException
and when that occured the status_code field was dropped. This causes errors
on the nova-side to occur as nova checks the status_code to do error handling.

Fixes bug: 1245700

Change-Id: Ie1fcf3fef0e20c33ce18549bca6a2413a9f98e9f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix status_code not passed in code

The python-neutronclient was refactored to raise NeutronClientException
and when that occured the status_code field was dropped. This causes errors
on the nova-side to occur as nova checks the status_code to do error handling.

Fixes bug: 1245700

Change-Id: Ie1fcf3fef0e20c33ce18549bca6a2413a9f98e9f

commit_message:
Fixes neutron setup for Debian

This patch completely removes the section_neutron-install.xml
section from the Debian install-guide, since that part is
completely automated in Debian, and describes how the plugin
system works in Debian. It then customize the other sections
to fit the Debian installation procedure.

Change-Id: Ib1fabd7f64d513132484b98541cef2e4276ccfe8
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit ac32f3ac9482eeeb3263bee51c097cb040eda0b5)

commit_message:
Fixes the API FlavorManageController delete method

nova flavor-delete accepts both 'id' and 'name' for deleting
a flavor. However, the existent implementation of the API
FlavorManager only looks for the flavor by id.

This patch adds a lookup also by name for the flavor that is being
deleted.

Change-Id: I4ed64647c2a45ed8ec19d17ac3a6e2545c908fc9
Closes-Bug: #1244043

subject: Brick connector fix for NFS drivers
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 06:32:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_coraid.py'], 'message': 'Brick connector fix for NFS drivers

This change fixes the error that comes
while getting brick connector and attaching volumes
in case of NFS drivers in cinder. The attribute for
mount point base was not passed to attach_volume method
as the connector initialization logic is common for all
types of protocols. It is fixed by populating

Change-Id: I8601326b318f6f8c53a03610f1b4f2bfd14070ff

commit_message:
Brick connector fix for NFS drivers

This change fixes the error that comes
while getting brick connector and attaching volumes
in case of NFS drivers in cinder. The attribute for
mount point base was not passed to attach_volume method
as the connector initialization logic is common for all
types of protocols. It is fixed by populating
the required parameter in the RemoteFsConnector
for NFS drivers.

Change-Id: I8601326b318f6f8c53a03610f1b4f2bfd14070ff
Closes-Bug: #1238085
(cherry picked from commit b6b9df2940ac07f715f759f4c315b2cf088c2320)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7179, 'name': 'Brad Pokorny', 'email': 'brad_pokorny@symantec.com', 'username': 'bpokorny'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 16:25:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_instance.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py'], 'message': 'Include instance sub-object updated dates when returning instance info

When getting instance info from the database, the "updated_at" field
currently shows the last updated date for certain fields, such as
server name.  However, the "updated_at" field doesn't reflect the
last time instance sub-objects such as info_cache, security_groups,
metadata, or system_metadata were updated.

This change updates the get_by_uuid and get_by_id logic so that the
"updated_at" field for the instance returns the latest updated date
for the instance and instance sub-objects.

Fixes bug 1237106

Change-Id: Ice82756e8fad7d4808f7d0e58264d08d4e285ea0
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Include instance sub-object updated dates when returning instance info

When getting instance info from the database, the "updated_at" field
currently shows the last updated date for certain fields, such as
server name.  However, the "updated_at" field doesn't reflect the
last time instance sub-objects such as info_cache, security_groups,
metadata, or system_metadata were updated.

This change updates the get_by_uuid and get_by_id logic so that the
"updated_at" field for the instance returns the latest updated date
for the instance and instance sub-objects.

Fixes bug 1237106

Change-Id: Ice82756e8fad7d4808f7d0e58264d08d4e285ea0

subject: Drop knowledge of db from node servers
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-09 22:25:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'No more db anything outside of db.py

Okay, it was a bit of a lie since we still have a few references to
broker.db_file scattered around, mostly as os.path.exists(db_file).
Those are to be rolled up in the "back-end initialization improvement"
review, so pretend they are gone.

This patch addresses a more difficult part: how to change what
a backend takes, from a file name to something more abstract,
while not blowing up the replicator.

At this point, the '.db' suffixes are no more visible to users
of backends, although hashes are still calculated above the API.
Even so, this was a little tricky.

Change-Id: I79a8c7bb82a20554080be06b211a8e06edc51c6d
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-09-19 04:39:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Drop knowledge of db from node servers

Since the draft of this patch was posted, a promising approach
was suggested by ondisk.py. It allows us to not to attempt to
shoehorn the use of replicators and auditors into the broker API
which knows of no databases. Accordingly, this version is more
aggressive and not only gets rid of ".db" suffix, but the
whole hash and path calculations in servers.

Change-Id: I79a8c7bb82a20554080be06b211a8e06edc51c6d
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-09-24 21:01:00.000000000', 'files': ['swift/account/backend.py', 'swift/common/db.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'swift/account/auditor.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'swift/account/server.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'Drop knowledge of db from node servers

Since the draft of this patch was posted, a promising approach
was suggested by ondisk.py. It allows us to not to attempt to
shoehorn the use of replicators and auditors into the broker API
which knows of no databases. Accordingly, this version is more
aggressive and not only gets rid of ".db" suffix, but the
whole hash and path calculations in servers.

Change-Id: I79a8c7bb82a20554080be06b211a8e06edc51c6d
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Drop knowledge of db from node servers

Since the draft of this patch was posted, a promising approach
was suggested by ondisk.py. It allows us to not to attempt to
shoehorn the use of replicators and auditors into the broker API
which knows of no databases. Accordingly, this version is more
aggressive and not only gets rid of ".db" suffix, but the
whole hash and path calculations in servers.

Change-Id: I79a8c7bb82a20554080be06b211a8e06edc51c6d

commit_message:
Specifics for nova install in Debian.

This patch removes things which are not needed to be in
the Debian installation chapter for Nova, and adds some
Debian specifics (plus remove the "Notes for Debian
users).

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana

Change-Id: I3c0f538acb392194733293478fa35e9824328fff

commit_message:
Add pipeline configuration for tempurl with swauth

The pipeline needs tempurl added before the auth middleware (swauth).
In addition we need to set allow_overrides=true when using swauth and
tempurl. This change introduces an attribute which an be overridden to
make both these changes.

* Add toggleable attribute to configure tempurl + swauth
* Update README with attribute info
* Add condition to proxy-server.conf template to insert tempurl into
     pipeline
* Take account of new dynamic role attribute
        [:swift][:management_server_chef_role]
* Correct name spelling

Change-Id: I035793230372c1a02de5f906f2ff6dde9f27d3ab

commit_message:
Adds redirection attribute for cron

Adds redirection attribute for cron jobs
to allow configuration downstream.  Possible
uses are no redirection(nil), /dev/null,
pipe to mail, logger, etc.

Change-Id: I384d399ee4c147a170b368a15997bc8f6686b372

commit_message:
Correct exception handling

Previously, it was possible for an exception to be hidden and cause other
errors for example:
    UnboundLocalError: local variable 'port' referenced before assignment
was previously occuring if e.status_code != 404

Fixes bug: 1245700

Change-Id: I27e44ffd33a73c88745de8fda8fd7c374435808a
