commit_message:
Check the run_context.loaded_recipes rather than the run_list, removed sysctl

* The 'openstack-network::server' recipe is most likely contained in a role and
  not explicitly in the run_list.
* The sysctl cookbook is unused and was removed as a dependency.
* The test was removed because I could not figure out how to stub the
  run_context of the chef_run and we are using ChefSpec 1.2 and all the
  documentation is for ChefSpec 3.0. I've commented it out to revisit when we
  upgrade to 3.0.

Change-Id: I4f4c60eaec9391c2871942dc95b557468f3bf85a

subject: Update schema_diff.py to use 'postgresql' URLs.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 15:28:56.000000000', 'files': ['tools/db/schema_diff.py'], 'message': "Update schema_diff.py to use 'postgresql' URLs.

This gets rid of a SQLAlchemy deprecation warning when using this tool w/
PostgreSQL:

The SQLAlchemy PostgreSQL dialect has been renamed from 'postgres' to
'postgresql'. The new URL format is
postgresql[+driver]://<user>:<pass>@<host>/<dbname>

This appears to have been deprecated in the SQLAlchemy 0.6 series so I think we
are Okay to remove it now.

Change-Id: If8fdf822ba452b387e9f2f3ec7c9157e4ae932f9
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update schema_diff.py to use 'postgresql' URLs.

This gets rid of a SQLAlchemy deprecation warning when using this tool w/
PostgreSQL:

The SQLAlchemy PostgreSQL dialect has been renamed from 'postgres' to
'postgresql'. The new URL format is
postgresql[+driver]://<user>:<pass>@<host>/<dbname>

This appears to have been deprecated in the SQLAlchemy 0.6 series so I think we
are Okay to remove it now.

Change-Id: If8fdf822ba452b387e9f2f3ec7c9157e4ae932f9

commit_message:
Fix query error on dhcp release port for postgresql

This is achieved by disabling eager loading and
hence by avoiding incurring in left outer joins
that cannot be applied because of a nullable
side.

Closes-bug: #1246788

Change-Id: I16bcc738a43609f715c2561413c6387f443bd99c

commit_message:
Add FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE and make it the default

Adds a new FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE option to lib/nova which
is by default enabled. Using config drive should speed
things up a bit and is a more likely production default
instead of file injection.

Change-Id: I2388ef0df12a6289b619bfaf30cb952fcc48ef41

subject: Turn off Nova firewall driver when using Neutron
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-31 20:49:35.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron'], 'message': 'Turn off Nova firewall driver when using Neutron

As referenced in the OpenStack documentation, the firewall_driver in
nova.conf should be set to nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver, "so
that nova-compute does not perform iptables-based filtering itself".

Without this change, the driver gets set to
nova.virt.libvirt.firewall.IptablesFirewallDriver, which seems to
make networking unusable.

Change-Id: Id9cce0f5f4efe719683aaf3284b128188b61b919
Closes-bug: #1246888
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Turn off Nova firewall driver when using Neutron

As referenced in the OpenStack documentation, the firewall_driver in
nova.conf should be set to nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver, "so
that nova-compute does not perform iptables-based filtering itself".

Without this change, the driver gets set to
nova.virt.libvirt.firewall.IptablesFirewallDriver, which seems to
make networking unusable.

Change-Id: Id9cce0f5f4efe719683aaf3284b128188b61b919
Closes-bug: #1246888

commit_message:
Add tempest unit test to verify the test list

If there is an error in a test file it could potentially not get run
in the tox jobs used for gating. This commit adds a test which looks
for ImportFailures in the test list to ensure that all the test files
will get run in the gate.

Change-Id: Ia0a5831810d04f2201bd856039362b4a30f39319

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-20 11:22:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'API tests for neutron router gateway

This patch adds tests for validating the Neutron API for managing
router gateways.

To run these tests successfully, the neutron client has been changed
to send the enable_snat attribute to the server only when executing
with admin credentials; this implied also a bit of refactoring in
test_quotas, which uses an admin client too.

Also, this patch adds the capability of specifying filter when
querying the API for ports, as this is needed by gateway tests.

Change-Id: I4e92384559bb2093c0eddf78f5dbb526af1acc38
Closes-Bug: #1228091

commit_message:
API tests for neutron router gateway

This patch adds tests for validating the Neutron API for managing
router gateways.

To run these tests successfully, the neutron client has been augmented
with a method to send the enable_snat attribute to the server; this
method should be invoked only when the client has admin credentials;

Also, this patch adds the capability of specifying filter when
querying the API for ports, as this is needed by gateway tests.

Change-Id: I4e92384559bb2093c0eddf78f5dbb526af1acc38
Closes-Bug: #1228091

commit_message:
Only run yum install once per package block

before we would get this:
yum install a
yum install a b
yum install a b c

Now we just get
yum install a b c

Closes-bug: #1235796

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 18:45:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove admin checks from database layer

Rather than having SQL Alchemy API check for admin roles/flags, it
should just return the data that was being requested.

To achieve this, two things needed to be done:

1. stack_get: this function does not check for tenant_id or admin flags
anymore, it just takes show_deleted into account when returning a stack;

2. stack_get_by_tenant: this function now enforces that the stack
tenant_id matches the context tenant_id. This method replaced previous
uses of stack_get

This way the admin check can be done elsewhere and the appropriate
function (stack_get or stack_get_by_tenant) can be used to retrieve
data.

Change-Id: I32c1156c8782bad39a265c77aad088c96400f69f
Closes-Bug: 1245952
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-30 15:36:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove admin checks from database layer

2. stack_get_by_tenant: this function now enforces that the stack

This way the admin check can be done elsewhere and the appropriate

commit_message:
Rename admin flag on SqlAlchemy#stack_get

The `admin` flag was only used to avoid doing a tenant_id check between
the stack and the context.tenant_id, so it was renamed to `tenant_safe`
for better clarity.

Change-Id: I32c1156c8782bad39a265c77aad088c96400f69f
Closes-Bug: 1245952

commit_message:
Fixes neutron setup for Debian

This patch completely removes the section_neutron-install.xml
section from the Debian install-guide, since that part is
completely automated in Debian, and describes how the plugin
system works in Debian. It then customize the other sections
to fit the Debian installation procedure.

Change-Id: Ib1fabd7f64d513132484b98541cef2e4276ccfe8
backport: havana

commit_message:
Adds a new debconf chapter

This patch adds a new debconf chapter in the Debian docs.
It describe generalities about the Debconf OpenStack. It
explains how the following is handled:
- Database config (using dbconfig-common)
- RabbitMQ config
- API endpoint registrations
- keystone_authtoken config
- preseeding

Also, a number of screenshots are added.

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ia5d8e5fc3d397f9441ecb50ef4a3458672307bdc

commit_message:
Recommend vCenter VMDK driver and other edits

Updated the VMware VMDK driver doc to recommend the vCenter VMDK
driver since the ESX VMDK driver has not been tested extensively.
Also made other edits to make the document easier to read.

backport: havana

Fixes bug #1246913

Change-Id: Iae910c59d0950cb19d18cded6a99842a1cbfd8b6
(cherry picked from commit 87d8f50d89ec2256cac5d0a270d8457bb98547e4)

commit_message:
Add notification for host operation

Add notification for the following host operations:
1) compute/api.py:set_host_enabled
2) compute/api.py:host_power_action
3) compute/api.py:set_host_maintenance

This can make sure 3rd party callers can get host status quickly.

Implements bp host-operation-notification

Change-Id: Ib4cc80e568b6028afbdd6cb86f6ac8edeed4f933

commit_message:
Fix checksum verification exception.

Previously if an invalid checksum was found, the exception would not be
raised. This commit also makes the tests for backup run in fake mode
run again (turns out there was no reason to disable them) since they
helped find this, and cleans up an issue with the restore backup test
(it used the current size of an instance created elsewhere for no
reason).

Fixes bug 1246368

Change-Id: I96a570a93695b017e5c6966fa1482d6ec5aef426

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 12:32:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Externalisation of heat template

Reasons: preparing trove to support multi-datastores
Changes: template loading, heat-support update
This code piece refactors the earlier code of instance creation
using heat.

- Configuration tempaltes stored at trove/templates/configuration
- Heat templates are stored in trove/templates/heat
- One template per datastore type
- New parameter - ImageId
- Removed SSH key parameter
- All resources are updated according to available OS resources
  (for more details please visit heat repository).

For each datastore  we have a unique template file
<datastore_type>.heat.template

Change-Id: If4f185542076e578c5148615cac2cc2a03cf9dbb
Implements: blueprint provide-custom-heat-templates-for-each-service-in-trove
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-29 17:09:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Externalisation of heat template

  (for more details please visit heat repository).

commit_message:
Externalisation of heat template

Reasons: preparing trove to support multi-datastores
Changes: template loading, heat-support update
This code piece refactors the earlier code of instance creation
using heat.

- Configuration tempaltes stored at trove/templates/configuration
- Heat templates are stored in trove/templates/heat
- One template per datastore type
- New parameter - ImageId
- Removed SSH key parameter
- All resources are updated according to available OS resources
  (for more details please visit heat repository).

For each datastore  we have a unique template file
<datastore_type>.heat.template

Change-Id: If4f185542076e578c5148615cac2cc2a03cf9dbb
Implements: blueprint provide-custom-heat-templates-for-each-service-in-trove

subject: Make compute periodic tasks intervals smart.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-06 02:04:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make compute periodic tasks have exponential backoff.

When a periodic task runs and it actually doesn't do anything,
either due to no data (aka nothing for the db) we shouldn't run it
again at the same interval to just retrieve nothing again but
instead we should expand the interval. When it refires and new
data arrives (instead of being empty) then we will reset to the initial
duration.

", 'number': 16}, {'created': '2013-04-06 20:53:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make compute periodic tasks intervals smart.

When a periodic task runs and it actually doesn't do anything,
either due to no data (aka nothing from the db/conductor) or due to not
having a underlying implementing driver we should not run it
again at the same interval to just retrieve nothing again but
instead we should expand the interval, or just disable the periodic task
to begin with. If a event comes in that should reset the interval,
like a compute 'boot' then we will reset to the initial duration (iff
not already disabled due to the underlying driver not implementing said
feature in the first place).

Fixes bug 1165275

commit_message:
Make compute periodic tasks intervals smart.

When a periodic task runs and it actually doesn't do anything,
either due to no data (aka nothing from the db/conductor) or due to not
having a underlying implementing driver we should not run it
again at the same interval to just retrieve nothing again but
instead we should expand the interval, or just disable the periodic task
to begin with. If a event comes in that should reset the interval,
like a compute 'boot' then we will reset to the initial duration (iff
not already disabled due to the underlying driver not implementing said
feature in the first place).

Fixes bug 1165275

DocImpact

Change-Id: Idc3b5b99b0dfd399f8682fcf7b31e50109a5e1a0

commit_message:
Enable network operations over neutron private nets

Enables communication between the savanna api server and the spawned
VMs over the specific network namespace associated with the selected
network.  The SSH and HTTP communication will be conducted over
netcat based subprocesses.  This feature is enabled when the
configuration indicates that neutron networking is enabled while
the use of public IPs is set to false.

Implements blueprint neutron-private-net-provisioning

Change-Id: I61d61a7ef6eccb04274549883dde489641d1da9b

subject: Fix to make ConfigOpts no longer obscure IOErrors
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 12:38:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "ConfigParser no longer obscures IOErrors

ConfigParser no longer interprets all IOErrors as 'No such file or
directory'. The current behavior does not change: 'No such file'
IOErrors are swallowed and dealt with elsewhere. The fundamental change
here is that other types of IOErrors are re-raised. (Before this, all
types of IOErrors--including, for example, 'Too many open files'--were
treated as 'No such file', which is obviously not correct.)

Also added a test to exercise the case where IOErrors are reraised. The
'No such file' case is already covered by existing tests.

Change-Id: I10e4e5965212737a19f4f17153143f62b5c0c83e
Closes-Bug: #1244674

all IOErrors as 'No such file or directory', and instead allows these
errors to propagate normally. The current behavior with respect to
ConfigOpts does not change for IOErrors indicating 'No such file' or

Change-Id: I10e4e5965212737a19f4f17153143f62b5c0c83e

commit_message:
Fix to make ConfigOpts no longer obscure IOErrors

This changes ConfigParser._parse_file such that it no longer interprets
all IOErrors as 'No such file or directory', and instead allows these
errors to propagate normally. The current behavior with respect to
ConfigOpts does not change for IOErrors indicating 'No such file' or
'Permission denied'.

Also added a test to exercise the case where IOErrors are reraised. The
'No such file' case is already covered by existing tests.

Change-Id: I10e4e5965212737a19f4f17153143f62b5c0c83e
Closes-Bug: #1244674

subject: Zoneextractor tool
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 17:38:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Contributing standalone tools

They may be useful to other Designate users/devs.

They are:

* designatehooks.py: Intended to run as a daemon, consume Central's MQ
notifications, and act on them. Developed to command a remote NSD 4 slave
server, efforts were made to keep it modular end extensible, so it can be used
to "hook" any external system into Designate.

* zoneextractor.py: Intended to help the client-side of the new zone import API,
it takes a BIND9 named.conf and writes out or prints a zonefile for every
configured master zone. Said zonefile can then be curled or otherwise submitted
to the zonefile import API.

* designatehooks.py: Module that provides classes to consume MQ

designatehooks.py to control a remote NSD 4 slave.

commit_message:
Zoneextractor tool

zoneextractor.py helps on the client-side of the new zone
import API. It takes a BIND9 named.conf and writes out or prints a
zonefile for every configured master zone. Said zonefile can then be
curled or otherwise submitted to the zonefile import API.

Change-Id: Ibc15639771da52e678be067ec4474bcbcc2f0865

subject: Fix ZeroDivisionError in ratio calculation
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-01 13:06:18.000000000', 'files': ['reviewers.py'], 'message': "Fix ZeroDivisionError in ratio calculation

Now that the script counts up +A, it's possible for someone to be in
the list with a total of 0 reviews (sum of -2,-1,+1,+2 votes), causing
this line to blow up.

Change-Id: Ia27226682673dce603a9a9a181234400d7ac4a16
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix ZeroDivisionError in ratio calculation

Now that the script counts up +A, it's possible for someone to be in
the list with a total of 0 reviews (sum of -2,-1,+1,+2 votes), causing
this line to blow up.

Change-Id: Ia27226682673dce603a9a9a181234400d7ac4a16
